characters: THE DOOR BEHIND HICKS BUCKLES ON ITS HINGES
THE DESERT RAT' S HOMEMADE CROSS
THE TWITCH OF BLACK LEATHER WINGS
ACROSS THE BODY OF THE TRAIN
A BLACK FIGURE DROPS SILENTLY FROM THE SKY BEHIND HER
DOZENS OF OPEN COFFINS FILL THE CAR
TEN TROOPERS IN FULL RIOT GEAR STORM IN
A FADED PHOTO OF THE PACE FAMILY
MUSIC SUDDENLY BURSTS FROM THE PIANO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MOON. So fat and full in the night sky you can reach and touch it. HICKS W. 0. This is what's known: There has always been man...and there have always been vampires. BLACK SHAPES swoop past the moonscape, vicious looking th Much shrieking and wailing. Atop a STONE ZIGGURAT -- We see a GROUP OF MEN -- AZTEC WARRIORS readying themselves with PRIMITIVE WEAPONS -- SLINGS, BOWS, SPEARS. Tonight they know they will die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the beginning -- the two have been locked forever in combat... The vampires were quicker, stronger and had the gift of flight. Quick glimpses of a bloody, brutal battle. Men screaming. Talons ripping. FIERY ARROWS launched against an unseen e

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH
dialogues.text: With a HOWL, we see A MAN plucked off the ground, his bod disappearing in the night. THE IMAGE DISSOLVES as -- the turns bright, the moon becoming a familiar ball of yellow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But man had the sun. THE CAMERA TILTS DOWN to find another GROUP OF MEN -- mor sophisticated than the first. Makeshift weapons made of m and steel slung across their backs glinting in the sunlig They stand before AN EARTHEN STRUCTURE, looks like a GIAN NEST. Unsheathing their weapons, they step grimly inside. We HEAR a HISSING WAIL and the wielding of steel.

dialogues.speaker: HXCKS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And so it went like this over many years. As man and vampire both evolved -- the wars became bloodier. From afar, we see GIANT STACKS OF CORPSES as hydraulic machines stack the black bodies into pyres as big as buildings, smoke rising to the sky in twisting columns.
Stands at the base of one of the mammoth pyres. Even from this angle we sens e his quiet dignity.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Then came THE PRIESTS -- The Man turns and we see his face is shadowed by a large CROSS TATTOO, cutting across his eyes and down the center

dialogues.speaker: HICKS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- Specially trained warriors in the art of vampire combat. They single-handedly turned the tide for the humans. Quick glimpses of a GROUP OF PRIESTS battling a FURY OF VAMPIRES (we still do not get a good look at them). Their technique is otherworldy -- combining the brutality of a Maori Warrior. with the grace of a Samurai. The--combat-is intense. Glorious. An explosion of blood a s b m i l

dialogues.speaker: HICKS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Over time the vampire threat faded. The once fierce race now fatally diminished. A shadow of what they once. were. Through heavy smoke, we see a pile of VAMPIRE CORPSES, a ragged collection of fangs and claws.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The remaining vampires were put Into camps and -- by decree of the High Clergy the Priests disbanded. The former warriors to be integrated as members of regular society. We see a WAX SEAL pressed onto an ancient parchment. The document carefully rolled and stored in an ORNATE CHAMBER

dialogues.speaker: HICKS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The human race thrived in relative quiet. The vampire menace quickly forgotten for other, more modern threats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the few surviving Priests faded Into quiet obscurity. The chamber is closed. We see an encrusted key turning in heavy set lock and we -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .s. Our story begins with the rusty SCRAPE of a windmill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust swirls in nasty tangles. A LONE MALE FIGURE moves across the plain, long and lean overalls. AARON PACE. Shadows flicker across his sunburne face, the windmill looming above him. in his hands is an ELECTRONIC DEVICE, he plunges it into earth. It makes a series of CLICKING SOUNDS, reading the Aaron looks up to see the silhouette of a WOMAN standing the doorway of his CABIN. He smiles, waving to her. His wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pioneer's wood cabin. Aaron sits surrounded, a lattice work of vines covering t walls and floors in beautiful patterns. Not a trace of so anywhere in the room, everything hydroponically grown.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Supper's on! He smiles, studying a. stunning RUBY RED FLOWER, separate the others. His crown jewel. He closes the door and enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANNON PACE carries a bowl filled with a steaming green broth, placing it on the dinner table, moving aside a tin FIGURINE OF JESUS. The surrounding furniture cluttered wi religious knickknacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been spending an awful lot of time behind that door. Makes a woman suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special project. It's taking a little more time than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing special about milkweed. Unless you like a thorn in the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Milkweed. Not this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see. His eyes skate to her face moving in for the kiss -- but

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yuck. Pershing-stew again. Their DAUGHTER (13). Already a heartbreaker. This girl is too young, too pretty to be out here in the badlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it anymore. This outpost. Being all cooped up like this. I'm going

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey...we know this hasn't been easy for you -- In two years someone else'll study the soil and this'll be their outpost. But for right now -- this is my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what it's like to have a best friend. To have any friends. I want to have a crush. I want secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a life. Shannon looks at her husband. She knew this day would com

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron. She's thirteen -- She should be with children her own age. Aaron lets out a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Next year, we'll figure out a way to get you to a school close by. In town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N year -- that's still plenty of time for you to have a "crush". Lucy deflates, knowing this is as good as it's going to g for awhile. Aaron takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow I'm heading in town to file. You come with, help your old man out, get a change of scenery. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now c'mon, stew's getting cold. Bow your heads and say grace. The family clasps hands. Whatever their differences, ther a bond here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord we thank you for what we are about to receive. Blessing us with your gifts... She.speaks with her eyes clenched shut, words spoken sincerely, nothing perfunctory about it. She's a believer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thank you for the earth and the sky and for your bounty through Christ our Lord -- She.stops, opening her eyes -- staring at the plates and glasses on the table. They're RATTLING.

dialogues.speaker: LU C Y, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. He cocks his ear, heading a low rumble. Although he's never heard the sound before...he knows it only mean one thing. Trying to remain calm, Aaron goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Framed by a BLOOD MOON hanging over the horizon, a DOZEN MOTORCYCLES race across the plain, ENGINES thundering.
The Jesus figurine falls off the table, SHATTERING to the floor. Aaron looks at Shannon, an expression on his face she has seen before -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the boards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Aaron doesn't answer, Shannon helping him position pre-cu planks across every window and door. Each with an iron-cr strut for support

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CYCLES circle the house, kicking up dust in sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the engines fills the house as Aaron pulls a POWERFUL LOOKING GUN from the drawer. He drops it, obviou not familiar with firearms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get by me. Shannon-and Lucy crouch at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cycles cut their engines, headlights centered on the house. A blistering spotlight. It's quiet. The RIDERS step from their machines. We don't get a look their faces as one by one they LEAP onto the house and windmill, SKITTERING across the walls and roof like spide The blades of the windmill slowly come to a stop. 11U. OUTPOST 10 r- SAME The power goes out, everything going black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

We hear the Riders crawling over the outside of the house Snarling, howling, making terrifying sounds. Then the worst sound of all. Wood being torn apart. BLAM! BLAN! Aaron SHOOTS like crazy, the white light MUZZ FLASHES providing glimpses of SHAPES moving inside the ho BLACK BODIES blown back. Shrieking. Everything happening lightening fast. Finally, the gun clicks empty and we're plunged back into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIGHTS COME BACK ON
dialogues.text: Aaron is still standing, the house in shambles around him He's alone.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: From outside we hear the cycles revving. Aaron runs to the door. Rips off the board in time to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycles racing away, a cloud of dust in their wak Aaron runs after but TRIPS on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her body lying in the dirt, head lurching at an obscene' angle. He brushes back her hair -- ere' g UNCT_URE MABKS in hem neck. Crying, he cradles his, wife. Feverishly looking around f

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: He keeps screaming but it's no use -- as the-motorcycles in the night he knows -- They've taken her. The CAMERA TILTS to the MOON hanging above the plain. it turns BLACK as we now find ourselves peering into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lip of an ENORMOUS SMOKESTACK. One of hundreds. A seemingly endless brick forest reaching to a sky heavy wi soot and ash, while below, miles of FACTORIES stretch and stretch.

dialogues.speaker: A STEAM WHISTLE BLOWS
dialogues.text: Quitting time. Hundreds of WORKERS trail listlessly from massive brick and stone COMPLEX. Grey faces betraying another day's toll.

dialogues.speaker: A TATTOOED FIGURE
dialogues.text: moves through the crowd, people stepping out of his way. They do this not out of respect. . .but fear. We don't get a good look at him. Just FLASHES -- Shaved head. Eyes like nail guns. Tendons clenching over muscle. As he walks,people whisper. He hears all of it. He heads into the streets. CITIZENS hurry by, some with. surgical masks over their mouths. There's a pale, sicklin to them. Malignant. The Figure suddenly stops. He cocks his bald head -- Something's caught his attention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move through trash and shadow finding -- A gang of FACTORY WORKERS, uniformed, surrounding a GIRL (12). Their LEADER holds her close, BUTCHER KNIFE at her throat. Mouth at her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead ...scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scream for daddy. He hears a noise, looks up and sees a SILHOUETTE standing the head of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like daddy's already here. (points the knife) Well, then. Come on daddy...make it better. The Figure steps into a pool of white light, giving us ou first good look at him -- A LAL RGE AK CROSS TATTOO shadows most of his-- a e. Acro the eyes and down the center. The Mark Of The Priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Priest! Well, lookie here.. We got us a real life war-hero boysl Heard you guys were real baddasses. The Workers all pull out large knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we'll find out. They move in on Priest, chemicals burning in their blood, mouths leering. Priest folds his hands into the prayer position. The Workers look at each other. Laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he gonna do. . .BLESS us to death? VOOMI -- There's a whirling SNARL of sound -- the sonic equivalent of a back flip and -- Pries is holding their knives. Before they can react, he throws the knives into their fe They HOWL, pinned to the concrete. Scared, the leader clutches the girl, pressing against th brick wall as Priest moves towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the war no more. You got no right meddlin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't belong here -- You ain't one of us.
And with that he RAISES the blade to the girl's throat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSHI A sudden RUSH OF AIR. The leader looks at the girl's neck, his blade's gone. So is his hand. Priest holds the severed limb, its fingers still clutchin the blade. The Leader collapses, a Holy Shitl expression frozen on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gawks at Priest, possibly more frightened of him than the workers. He turns to her, wanting to comfort her but not knowing h She flinches and runs away, disappearing into the street. A BEAT as Priest pries the butcher blade from the hand, wiping it off. Tucks it in his waistband. He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gone to seed. The once proud house of God now a sad collection of moldering stone and cracked stained glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH past row after row of empty pews. We stop on the CONFESSIONAL BOOTH -- a foot sticking out the door --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: FATHER KOEPPEN, body skinny and ravaged. The old man pour himself a drink and downs it. Coughing. The confessional door opens, someone steps inside the oth booth. We can't see who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless me Father for I have sinned...again. The voice is like gravel from the bottom of a deep well. Quietly commanding. Koeppen knows it well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I caught the ambulance picking up what was left of the factory boys...figured it was your handywork. The Shape leans forward, we see it is Priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time there was a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if this keeps occurring it'll be .impossible to keep it from the Clergy. You'll get us both excommunicated. Priest gazes into the vestibule, his voice almost a whisp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the other Priests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can't. The Clergy forbids it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have their reasons. Priest flicks his eyes over Koeppen as if he could see through the vestibule, but his expression doesn't change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And their reasons for building more and more factories? The sky is turning black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is. industriousness a sin? Did Jesus not teach us to be productive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As your appointed counselor take my advice, . .Relax -- Take up a hobby, pick a vice. Make friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a wicked old man who'd sell his parish for a pint of whiskey. Priest seems to deflate, his hard shell cracking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's happening to me. (7, Questions. Doubts. I'm not sure what it is. Koeppen slides the vestibule open so they are now face to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The devil comes in many shapes. Do yourself a favor, keep your head down. Be smart. And most of all remember your oath... He hands Priest a set of ROSARY BEADS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To go against the Church is to go against God". This statement has always been the boilerplate of Priest' existence -- but tonight, it Just sounds like empty dogma squeezes his eyes shut, clutching the,rosary as we CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garbage litters the floor. The sound of water dripping. Priest stands, waiting for the lift to arrive. A BOY AND HIS MOTHER wait too. The boy stares at Priest, fascinated, his mother doing her best to pretend not to notice him. The elevator arrives and they step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it rises, a single bulb flickers above. Buzzing. The boy continues to stare at Priest, bewitched by the ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it hurt? The lift grinds to a stop. The mother quickly pulls her s out as the door rolls open, glaring at Priest, disappeari down a dark corridor. And only now does Priest answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The lift door clatters shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparse, containing only what's needed. Priest peels off his shirt revealing a constellation of o battle scars -- Punctures. Scratches. Bite marks. His ski showing the early signs of aging. He goes to the lone decoration in his apartment --

dialogues.speaker: A FADED PHOTO OF THE PACE FAMILY
dialogues.text: He takes the picture off the wall, studying it. The image bringing him peace. From the streets below, the sound of a GUNSHOT. He looks at the rosary beads, still in his hand. He turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to sleep, Priest sits on the edge of his bed. Pray There's a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER, (0. S.)
dialogues.text: Messenger. Priest opens the door. A MESSENGER holds up a PUNCH CARD.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER, (CONY ' D)
dialogues.text: I gota Priority Punch. Originated in the wasteland. Priest takes the card, the man writing up a receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest goes to a WOODEN BOX, feeding the punch card into A Rube Goldberg-like device of PULLEYS and WINCHES squeak life, like a sail, a SCREEN rises and Aaron appears, his a smudge. He looks awful. A man at the end of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L-Lucy's gone. They t-took her. I tried to stop 'em. I knowouu're..."retired". But can you find her? Find her before --.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed Shannon. The screen goes blank. Priest shuts his eyes, making the sign of the cross. His hand curls into a fist.

dialogues.speaker: LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Magnificent. At the Cities center, a municipal of baroque BASILICAS AN .CHURCHES -- all safely walled off from the rest of the metropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giant shafts of moonlight hit a marbled floor. Priest and Father Koeppen are led by FOUR OFFICERS before TRIBUNAL OF MONSIGNORS (all at least in their 70's). They sit behind a giant table cloaked in the florid robes of t religion. Men of scripture, creed and doctrine. Priest kneels, bowing his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for meeting with me on such short notice, Monsignors. Even the Monsignors are uneasy'around Priest. Their leade ORELAS, leans forward, addressing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Koeppen notified us of the situation. Our prayers are with your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come before you because I would like my authority to be reinstated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what grounds? Priest is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my blood, Monsignor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proper authorities are handling the situation. I'm sure they'll.do a fine job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proper authorities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All occurrences of vampire. disobedience and felonies are strictly a Federal matter now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Priests did too good a job. The vampire population is classified as endangered. They're protected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Monsignor...they are the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were.the enemy. The war ended a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so long that we should forget what they are capable of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would do well to remember the words of our Savior: Turn the other cheek. Embrace your enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not our place to interfere --- or yours. Priest looks up, obviously in great turmoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be of.great service to the investigation. I -can
0 The tribunal shifts uncomfortably, intimidated by Pries Orelas stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forget yourself, Priest... It has been brought to our attention that you have engaged in a number of transgressions. Tell me...do you feel yourself to be above God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Monsignor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaging in any kind of practice is sacrilege -- You bring shame upon our house. Priest turns the full force of his gaze on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father which is in Heaven" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monsignor POUNDS the table. MONSIGNOR ORELAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dare quote scripture to met Questioning the . authority. of the Clergy is forbidden1 If you engage in another transgression.you will be stripped from the Order and excommunicated immediately. Do I make myself clear? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.' MONSIGNOR ORELAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said do I make myself clear,. Father. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Monsignor. MONSIGNOR ORELAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a soldier. God's soldier-- Act like one. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember your vow: "To go against the Church is to go against God". 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers start to lead Priest and Koeppen out the cha

dialogues.speaker: MONSIGNOR ORELAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- Eather..Kam, please stay behind for a moment, a .we have something we need to discuss. Off Koeppen's expression we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOMELESS stand single file, wrapped around the corner, bl flakes of ash drifting down as they await tonight's suppe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest sits alone, rosary beads clutched in his hands. He looks up to find Koeppen, the old man staggering as he do an EXPENSIVE BOTTLE OF WHISKEY, three sheets to the wind. KOEPPEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I'd find you here. He sits, pouring himself another drink, toasting the poor souls at the surrounding tables. KOEPPEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many nights in this very spot? You with your endless questions on the nature of suffering-Me with none of the answers. Priest doesn't even acknowledge him, lost in his thoughts KOEPPEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now I'm the one with a question. This one's a riddle. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is greater than God-but more evil than the Devil? The poor have it, the rich need it -- and if you eat it...you'll die. Priest looks, up, his eyes cold. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't they listen to me? A beat. Koeppen takes another drink. KOEPPEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm going to.give you one more riddle and if you listen close - you might just hear an answer to your question. (clears his throat) (MORE)
KOEPPEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can a man who spent his whole life searching for devils miss the ones staring him in the face? From behind, a CLICKING sound. Priest turns to find an OFFICER standing, LASER-GUIDED SHOTGUN pointed at him. The soup kitchen suddenly deathly quiet. KOEPPEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Church feels it's better to keep you under its care...at least until this trouble with your niece blows over.. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't do that. KOEPPEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I figured.

dialogues.speaker: TEN TROOPERS IN FULL RIOT GEAR STORM IN
dialogues.text: Jackboots CLACKING, they form a circle around Priest and Koeppen. Guns SNAP into place, laser points dotting his b Priest looks at Koeppen -- betrayed. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? KOEPPEN (TOASTING RUEFULLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To go against the Church is to go against God'. Priest looks around the room -- FAMILIES AND HOMELESS hud at the surrounding tables, terrified. There's only one thing left for him to do. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ...I go against God. In an eyeblink -- Priest strips the gun from the nearby officer, CRACKING i against the trooper's head, his attack graceful and preci a whirlwind of PINPOINTED BLOWS and SHATTERED BONES. When it's over, eleven troopers lie on the ground writhin Everything goes quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks, from his father.'' knee, slowly moving towards window, drawn by a FLICKERING SHADOW. His mouth drops open as --

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: PUNCH through the windows in unison, showering everybody glass! BULLETS whistle through the air, everyone SCREAMIN as they scramble for cover. The father diving for his son PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folds his hands into the prayer position. VOONI There's a POP OF AIR and --- ' SILENCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The: troopers look around confused -- their guns have disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: ON A NEARBY TABLE
dialogues.text: A neat pile of shotguns sit, every FIRED BULLET collected harmlessly in a clean circle around them ...as if picked of thin air.

dialogues.speaker: THE LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: is somehow back with his father, the two safely holding hands, staring stupidly at each other. Priest is gone. KOEPPE4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks at his fancy whiskey bottle, inside now floats Prie ROSARY BEADS. He fishes them from the bottle, hand shakin KOEPPEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven help us. He takes a swig. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STRIKE of a match -- a prayer candle is lit, glowing the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: Priest kneels, eyes clenched shut in prayer. A large figurine of Jesus on the cross looms over him. The Christ expressive -- He suffers. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh my God...I am sorry for. having offended you. it was never my intention to do so... His words continue OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest standing in front of a STEEL DOOR. Hasn't been ope for some time.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I want so much to firmly resolve with the help of your grace to sin no more and to .avoid the near occasions of sin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR slides open just a crack. A sliver of light land on a piece of BLACK SCULPTED METAL.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST W.S. CONT'D
dialogues.text: But I can't.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STORAGE UNIT NIGHT
dialogues.text: An ENGINE ROARS, RUMBLES, idling... a throaty GURGLE... P pulls out on a BLACK MOTORCYCLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if this thing were a horse it'd be the ultimate stallion- Pulse engine. Nitrous. The works. A panel of black titani solar cells covers the bike like armor. He races onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheets of rain fall like lead. Pooling in the gutters.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: All I can do is ask for forgiveness for what is yet to come...
The cycle knifes through the city. Expertly working his w through congested streets. Moving past tent cities, stockyards and rusty industrial machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a MASSIVE WALL -- A hundred feet high, surrounding city. Priest pulls up to a CHECKPOINT TOWER. A PHALANX OF GUARDS with big shotguns at the ready, snapping into plac Mugs like anvils.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I now know the devil lives within me. The sins coming all too easy... Still on his bike, Priest's foot touches the ground, bloc our view as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MASSIVE DOOR/WALL sliding open with a KLANG1 revealin the wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (0.3.)
dialogues.text: And all too frequently. Priest REVS his bike, gunning out the doors. UNCONSCIOUS BODIES left in his wake. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blazing sun. An endless plain of cracked earth. Nothing around anywhere... VROOMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest's cycle streaks across the salt flats. It's glorio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest rides past a line of ANCIENT STATUES dominating th landscape, each representing one of the seven deadly sins sentinels marking the boundary into the deep wasteland. He FLOORS it, the bike PUNCHING for the horizon, a thick of dust funneling behind it... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet, Just the sound of the rusty windmill. The onl light provided by the moon reflecting off Priest's cycle, he's just arrived. He crouches, examining,a fresh TIRE TREAD. He stares, tak the landscap e, feeling it. Then he steps inside the cabin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a war zone. Splintered furniture everywhere sprays of dried, black blood over the floorboards. He brushes away rubble and finds a DRESS, Shannon's. Putt his face to it, he inhales, his expression softening. BEHIND HIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly, A COWBOY HAT and a SHOTGUN BARREL emerge from a in the floor. COWBOY HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, now -- Not another step. Climbing out from the hole, both barrels pointed, is SHER HICKS (22). You could say the name fits. But you'd only b half right. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you'd come back for a souvenir, hub? You gotta be the dumbest bloodsucker I ever come across. Priest steps into a pool of moonlight, illuminating his f PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was a vampire you'd be dead already. The cross tattoo, a striking image. Hicks stares, pushing his hat back on his forehead. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be dammed. He casually spits some ATOMIC CHAW, hitting the floorboar with a SIZZLE. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks and Priest ride in tandem across the plain. Hicks' bike a standard police vehicle, nothing fancy but reliabl They head towards town, passing aWOODEN SIGN`-- HALBRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a glance this seems like one of those frontier towns f an old western. TOWNSPEOPLE gather around a SNAKE-OIL SALESMAN, the man pitching his wares before a painted van reading DR. TOMLI MEDICINE SHOW. TRANCE MUSIC wafts from the nearby saloon.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Do I ask for three dollars?' Do I ask for two dollars? No folks! ONE dollar! One piece of tin and protection is yours!

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST AND HICKS
dialogues.text: Pull up in front of the Jail. Hicks eyes the salesman, coolly dismounts and adjusts his hat. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВўScuse me a minute, He heads towards the crowd, the salesman continuing his p

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Vampires are a deadly lot! YOU could be next I I seen a Blackblood bite a man like a gingersnap! The only sure way to be safe is a bag of DR. TOMLIN' S WONDER POWDERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up a sack) If you care about your loved ones then you MUST have this amazing elixir in your homes tonight -- WHOOSH! A KNIFE slices through the air, spears the sack a pins it to a nearby wall with a THUNK. Hicks steps to the front of the crowd. it's his knife. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best get in that van and clear on out, mister.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: For what reasons? I'm a legitimate business man. Hicks PULLS his SIX-SHOOTER, cocks it. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got six right here.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Sheriff, I am shocked you can be.so cavalier with the safety of your TOWNFOLK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAM! A bullet blows out the van's headlight. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one. KAPOW! The windshield cracks like a spiderweb. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. Immediately, the salesman quickly packs up his wares, scrambling for the van door. As he gets in, he catches a look at Priest, pauses a moment, then starts up the vehic and quickly PEELS away. Hicks pulls the knife from the wall, holds the bag up to crowd. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you all listen up. This bag ain't good fornothin' but linin' that man's pockets with your hard earned money. Much shuffling amongst the people -- they trust in their sheriff but they're frightened. An older man named, CROCK steps up. CROCKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know'that. You're just a kid. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen enough two-bit hustlers and carry barkers. He ain't no better. CROCKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if he's right? Hicks tosses the sack to Crocker.
HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look. (Crocker does, the contents spilling to the ground) Ain't nothin' but sand, flour and maybe 'a little garlic.. Oldest trick in the WASTELAND: (TO EVERYONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I don't blame you for bein' afraid. But those vampires headed clear .on out and they ain't comin' back. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the girl? Hicks pauses. This is not easily said. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I filed a report with the Cities last night. I'm sure they're Join' all they can. The townspeople mutter amongst themselves. Hicks looks ov to Priest, a GROUP OF CHILDREN have already gathered,. pointing and whispering at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole in the wall. A few wanted posters and postal warra tacked up on a board beside asingle jail cell. Hicks leads Priest inside. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already had one of the boys send for your brother. We got him put up at Paddy's place. Priest gazes out . the; window. A group of TOWNSPEOPLE ar milling out front, staring at him.. He pulls down the sha

dialogues.speaker: HICKS, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to excuse the attention.. We don't get strangers `round here too much -- "Specially no Priest. 'Course we ain't never had no vampire attack in.these parts before. (eyeing Priest.) But then you're just here to perform the service, right? Priest doesn't reply, staring at a yellowed wanted poster
HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never much of a believer myself. I figure I got one bullet to shoot. I'm gonna shoot it my way... not how some BOOK tells me to. (SPITS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do hear things...it true what they may about you folks? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fold time? At that, Priest turns, looking at Hicks. Before he can answer the door opens and -- AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes through, looking older than the last time we saw hi Seeing Priest, his face cracks, smiling for the first tim days. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came. Overcome, he wraps his arms around his brother, embracing him. Priest hugs him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLIND GRAVEDIGGER plays an old.SQQUEEZEBOX, hands exper working the bellows. He's done this for every.,funeral in Halbridge for the last fifty years. The sad music drifts across the wasteland. SHANNON'S COFFIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies in a freshly dug hole. Priest sprinkles dirt across. casket, offering prayers. Aaron watches,. silently. A GROUP OF TOWNSPEOPLE encircle grave. Everyone wearing black goggles for protection from the swirling dust. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands apart from the others, hat in his hands. His eyes focused on Priest. Not even watching as -- Aaron plants the RUBY RED FLOWER at the head of the grave Its glorious color almost obscene in this barren wastelan CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT. PADDY'S PLACE
dialogues.text: A DOG rests lazily in front of a rotating fan. PADDY'S a bear of a man, the town bachelor. He plops down bowls of brown stew before a waiting and hungry Aaron and Priest, The gruel smells foul, tastes fouler. PADDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackrabbit Stew. Never served no man of the cloth before. Hope you like it spicy, Father! He stands over both of them, eager for a response. Priest takes a sip, grimaces, tries his best to smile but fails hideously. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Delicious PADDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him on the back) `Course it isl it was me Ma's recipe. As Paddy jubilantly walks away, Priest puts the bowl on t floor and the dog pads over, eagerly lapping it up. Aaron smiles. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you never came round more? You know you were always welcome. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the war was over we figured you'd stay with us. Shannon was real fond of you. Lucy too. She was always asking about you. Uncomfortable with the conversation, Priest pulls out a m unrolling it onto the wooden table. He moves his finger across the paper. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pack headed in this direction. There's a reservation up that way so that's where I'll start. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if anyone finds out you're doing this --
o r PRIEST You're my brother. Aaron nods. This is enough,

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: I'll find her. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you' 11 bring her back to me. Something in Priest's face darkens. He doesn't answer, no able to look his brother in the eye. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOPCLERK mops the floor, guns of all types lining his walls. Everything from old Smith and Wesson's to the late and most powerful hand cannons. With a jingle, the door opens revealing Priest. The clerk smiles. All he needs is one look and he knows -- This guy good for business. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, sir! How may I be of service? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need bullets. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many do you have? The clerk laughs... then realizes he's serious. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, Father. You got a permit, right? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this. He pulls out a sack of coins, it hits the counter with a solid THUD. The clerk smiles wider..

dialogues.speaker: INT. PADDY'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Hundreds of bullets all orderly lined on a table top. Priest site with his back to us, hunched over a candle. We're unable to see what he's doing. Aaron picks up a bullet, twirling it in the light. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if I knew how to use these she'd still be alive. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes things just happen. Fault's got nothing to do with it. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. I'm the one who used to say that. You were the one who always said everything was God's will. Priest takes the bullet from him. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure anymore. There's a KNOCK at the door. Aaron opens it slightly. It' Sheriff Hicks. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind if I have a word-with your brother? An awkward BEAT as the two stare at each other. Both know what the other's thinking. PRIEST (0.S. It's alright. Let him in. Eyeing Priest, Aaron lets the Sheriff in, shutting the do behind him as he leaves. The vibe in the room is uncomfortable -- Priest not even acknowledging Hicks. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you're well aware of the Vampire Protection Act. (MORE)
HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it strictly states it is forbidden for anyone to hunt vampires anymore. C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest doesn't say anything, he just keeps working. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These days, things go through proper channels. Paperwork drawn up. investigators called in. Procedures followed. (spits, a wad of tobacco) 'Course we both know after a week, girls taken by vampires either and up dead or worse -- turned. (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you also wouldn't be surprised to know my office's'been contacted. I'm supposed to arrest you on sight. He pulls a SHINY OBJECT from his pocket, puts it on the t beside Priest. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other hand -- if I go after Lucy there'll be a warrant on mybead too...and that'll put us in the same briar patch. O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest looks at the object -- It's Hicks' sheriff's badae Five points glowing brightly in the candlelight. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We leave at sun up. Priest turns. A moment as each man studies the other. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the only chance she's got. Priest picks a bullet from the table, a carefully notched CROSS now in its tip (this is what he's been doing). He SNAPS it in the air. PHHHHTTI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hick's knife FLIES across the room, PINNING the bullet to wall. A thin trickle of gun powder leaks from its casing, spilling to the floor. The kid's fast. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you with a gun?
HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than I am with a knife. Priest considers this. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there. Nothing more needing to be said, Hicks turns to walk out, stops at the door. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with all the bullets anyway? I thought Priests don't use firearms. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're for you. Hicks nods, realizing Priest was ahead of him the whole t

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Moonlight streams through an open window. Priest places his bible on the nightstand and crouches be the:.bed, closing his eyes. Hands clasped. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Father who art in Heaven, hallowed be thy name. Thy Kingdom come Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven... As he continues THE CAMERA slowly moves OUT THE WINDOW an into the night, moving across HALBRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those that trespass against us and lead us not into temptation but deliver us from evil. We see the TOWNSPEOPLE: lock their doors, bolting the shutters, tucking their children in safely for the night.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: For thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory, forever and ever. Amen. And now the camera stops on a LARGE SHADOWY FIGURE perche nearby roofline.

The only thing we can see of it is a DUSTER illuminated b the SOFT GLOW OF A LIT CHEROOT...the Figure watches Pries he finishes his prayer and blows out a candle. Silently, the Figure takes off. Flying into the night. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is brightening, the edge of the world turning whi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight hits Shannon's grave, the CROSS MARKER casting a shadow, the once glorious red flower already withered. Aaron watches the sunrise, some other time he would've be moved by the sight, maybe even cried. This morning... not Priest is beside him. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never talked much about the war but I know you saw things. Bad things. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do...to make yourself unsee `em? To make it stop playing in your head? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prayed. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it help? Priest doesn't answer, the question hanging overhead, a d cloud. AARON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never used to be much on faith. You KNOW THAT (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Lucy was born. .and as soon as I saw her I knew. I Just knew -ГЇВїВЅ- There's no way something so perfect came from me. She was a gift. From God. (looks at Priest) You find her. Whatever it takes. Find Lucy.
Priest nods, his brother's eyes burning into him. Hearing sound of an engine, both men turn to find Hicks pulling u HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't mean to be late -- My deputies are a little green about keepin' the peace all by their lonesome. Needed a pep talk. (TO PRIEST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure I'll ride point. I know my way `round the Wasteland better than just `bout anyone. ' Without so much as a word, Priest climbs on his cycle and kick starts it, the engine REVVING to life. VROOMI off he goes. Hicks can't help but laugh. HICKS (CONT'D) (TO AARON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real charmer, your brother. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just his way. Don't pay it no mind. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just bring back my baby. Hicks nods. Then he REVS the throttle, speeding after Pri Aaron.,.watching until their cycles are just distant spec CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS as Priest and Hicks BLAST across the ba wasteland. They make a strange pair, not exactly Butch an SUNDANCE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A. THUNDERING past Strange ROCK FORMATIONS, bizarre shado cast across the plains. B. A group of WANDERING MONKS, holy men carrying offering the desert, bow as they race by. C.- We.see a PHOTO OF LUCY now stuck to Hicks' windscreen CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astride their bikes, Priest and Hicks, look down at a val A SERIES OF ADOBES sit clustered in the basin. CRYPTS.
HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nightshade Reservation.. Ain't nothin' but red-outs and rejects. They're a fallen tribe. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way. We have two hours to get in and out. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens in two hours? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sundown. Hicks looks up at the sky. The sun tilting towards the horizon. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest and Hicks enter engines idling, flocks of chickens riot underneath their tires CLUCKING. wildly. Crumbling structures. Squalor. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how most of the reservations are these days. We see faces peering out from wooden slats. Gaunt,: lifel eyes. These'are FAMILIARS. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Familiars are illegal. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody really enforces it. most come from the fringes. Drifters. They're creepy as all hell -- but harmless. They turn off their bikes and dismout. Hicks stepping awkwardly between the chickens. A MALE FAMILIAR stands with a butcher knife over a basin. His gaze is slack -- More dead than alive. He picks up a chicken and CHOP1 off goes its head, blood draining into container. His voice a hissing rasp. S
FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Sheriff... Father. What brings you to Nightshade? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for a Vamp Pack. They woulda' came through here a couple nights ago. FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody comes through Nightshade. That's the way we like it. Nice and quiet. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you won't mind if we have a look around? The Familiar picks up another chicken. Raises the butcher knife. FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. CHOPI The head clatters to the ground. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest and Hicks move through the reservation looking for clues. Priest goes to the nearest structure, TWO EYES pee from a tiny slat. The CRYPT'S FAMILIAR. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to find anything out here...We have to get into the crypts. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not supposed: to do that without a warrant -- BAMI -- Priest kicks the door in. We hear the Familiar SCREECH as Priest steps inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light of the sun's never been in here. Probably shoul have stayed this way. Tiny bones-cover the entire floor., excrement smearing the walls. The Crypt Familiar cowers-in the corner, shielding his ey from-the light. His body'fishbelly white and sickly.
CRYPT FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing). Got Got You must got Master will be angry! Nicks is grimacing from the stench. He looks at Priest, n happy as he approaches a STONE SARCOPHAGUS. Running his h over it. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the girl? CRYPT FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLEEASE please got PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Maybe your Master will know. CRYPT FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOt NOI THE MASTER CANNOT BE DISTURBEDI Priest rests his hand against the. atone slab covering.th tomb. It must weigh 200 pounds. He moves the slab. Just a centimeter -- but the Familiar screeches. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh re is she? CRYPT FAMILIAR (SOBBING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Please don't hurtmy Master. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your.Master'll be dead. He shoves the slab more, the light rays hanging just outs the edge. And now The Familiar begins to laugh, a horrible rattling sound. Something in his mood has shifted. CRYPT FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, i don't think so. Hearing a noise, Hicks turns, witnessing a horrible sight moving towards him

dialogues.speaker: THE NIGHTSHADE FAMILIARS
dialogues.text: About ten of them. Real Night Of The Living Dead stuff. Makeshift weapons in their hands:. Scythes, Slingblades, Buzzsaws.
Before Hicks can react -- A FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attacks, BUTCHER BLADE raised. CHOP! the blade buries its in Hicks' arm! HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets loose with a mean roundhouse. Plugging him in the chest. in one quick motion he rips the butcher blade from his arm, flinging it at the nearest FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blade lodges in his skull and he drops like a sack. These guys move surprisingly fast -- Hicks is already surrounded. He hears a whistling noise as

dialogues.speaker: A BUZZSAW BLADE
dialogues.text: knifes through the air heading straight for him. He DUCKS the blade whistling past, sawtoothing into the torso of another Familiar. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls off his COWBOY HAT. Activating a release. With a CLICK! thousands- of needle--like teat ext e d fro the br With deadly accuracy, he flings the hat: It FLASHES throu the air, DAIS'iWHEELING around a Familiar's neck, pinpric his skin and finally whirling back to Hicks' band likean obedient pup. A BEAT as the Familiar stands, mouth agape. Then with a w SNAP his head rolls off his shoulders, THUDDING in the di Hicks falls to the ground, his wound starting to get the of him. He musters up his strength for another hat attack but before he can -- PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaps in front. Blocking his way. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. With a HORRIBLE SCREECH the Familiars attack, LAUNCHING a Priest and Hicks. Blades in the air.

Priest CHARGES into the frenzy. A juggernaut. His movemen clean and calculated, bones breaking around him with a we snap, bodies THUDDING at his feet. When the dust clears, Priest stands alone... and he is ho their weapons. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can do this easy -- He tosses the BUTCHER KNIFE, it sticks in the ground a hairline from a Familiar's head. PRIEST (CONTID)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we can do this HARD -- Priest flings another BLADE. This one PLANTS in the leg o the Familiar. He HOWLS. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? THE FAMILIAR (CACKLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late, Priest -- He points to the horizon, the last rays of daylight disappearing. CRYPT FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our time now. We hear a LOW RUMBLE from inside the crypts. Priest looks Hicks, a feeling of dark electricity in the air, anticipa PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get your gun arm? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna need it. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLABS on each sarcophagus sliding open. SHAPES roiling in the blackness inside. The sound of dark, mewling things. Things already sensing trouble in their midsts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRYPT FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: THE MASTERS ARE AWAKING
dialogues.text: BLACK SHAPES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURST from the crypt doorways SCREECHING as they fly into air. Circling above the reservation like a nest of angry hornets. Disturbed. WHOOSH! One of the figures SWOOPS low, touching to the ground. Giving us our first good look at a vampire; Wet, white skin. Insect clicking claws. Black eyes. Fangs. More creature than human. The vampire cackles, sounds like dried paper, its voice a series of teeth clicking hisses. as it eyes Priest angril LEAD VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here,. Priest... haven't you already done enough? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want a fight. We're just looking for the girl. The vampire sneers and as it speaks the following -- one by one, the OTHERS drop from the sky, flanking him. They' scraggly, a little undernourished. LEAD VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us -- Living in ruin, forced to feed off the blood of animals. We once scoured 'this land. We were warriors...we were Gods! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were murderers. LEAD VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were what nature made us. (flashes his fangs) I recommend you leave immediately...You are not welcome here.
ONE BLACK FIGURE still flies above. Like a vulture, it circles Hicks. Marking him. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere until you tell us where she is. LEAD VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you aren't going anywhere,. If there was a tumbleweed in the vicinity this is when it blow by. A tense BEAT then. . .Priest pulls out a BLACK B PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ,,Yea though r walk through the Valley Of The Shadow Of Death x will fear no Evil -- " The vampires laugh. Fangs glinting. LEAD VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --'Your words mean nothing to us, Priest. And now we see the book's actually hollow on the inside, filled with dozens of .little STAR-METAL CROSSES. PRIEST 1 - 6 (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. in one quick motion Priest scoops a handful, snapping his WRIST AND THE CROSSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT through the air, heading straight for the BLACK FIGUR S t SOUEAL.S as the metals; it like hot goals through 1 err tC erina it apart, the pieces raining' down around Hicks, crashing to the ground. And then all hell breaks loose. The Nightshade Vampires hiss. Bearing their fangs like cobras and taking to the air with a SHRIEK. Attacking. Frightened beyond shit-all-belief -- Hicks FIRES wildly, chasing the creatures with his gunfire. His bullets whistling harmlessly through the air. WHOOSH! A vampire swoops towards him, fangs bared, claws ready to rip. PRIEST
Leaps at the creature just in time, driving it to the gro in one brutal motion he. straddles it, twisting its head horrible angle. He turns to Hicks. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: FOCUS.
dialogues.text: And with that he's gone, rolling across the ground like a boulder and LEAPING at TWO DARTING VAMPIRES. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, watches as the vampire's body erupts with death spasms, arms and legs kicking the air in a violent frenzy until finally all life drains away. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Jesus. Another VAMPIRE careens towards him. Coming in low, crawl across the ground on all fours. Fangs dripping. Hicks FIRES off a mess of bullets, peppering the creature it flails backwards screeching. He snaps out the empty shells, reloading almost supernaturally fast, firing off shot that SPLITS the Vampire's throat. He twirls the gun, flipping it into his holster. This leaves only

dialogues.speaker: THE LEAD VAMPIRE
dialogues.text: Perched atop his crypt like a gargoyle, raging at Priest Hicks from the depths of hell with at HORRIBLE SHRIEK. In full fury, he LEAPS and flies away, the sounds of his torment echoing throughout the canyon as he vanishes into night sky. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go after him? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need. He'll the at first light. Priest goes to the Familiars still lying on the ground. They're sobbing, having lost everything in the world that mattered. Completely wrecked. He grabs one by the scruff the neck.
10 PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more masters. Just you and me. He raises a knife, pressing it to the Familiar's skin. FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened beyond belief) -- The metal beast! She's in the metal beast! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make 'sense. FAMILIAR (JABBERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke. Look for the smoke -- SHARP CLAWS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly RIP across Priest's back! It's the Lead Vampire, back for more. Claws digging into flesh. Priest wrenches around and the two go at it. A fierce, fe battle. The Vampire's fangs chattering inches from his ne Their bodies lock in a horrible struggle, rolling across Familiars. The Vampire's claws CHURNING into their bodies killing them instantly. THE VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throws Priest into a crypt, SMASHING him through the wall flying in after him. We hear the sounds of a BATTLE ROYAL from inside. WHUMPI WHUMPI WHUMP! The walls buckle outwar sounds like the fury of all hell being unleashed. Then, suddenly, and'more disturbingly...,s ГўВЂВћ g. Hicks takes a step towards the crypt. Gun leveled. But -- PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerges through the hole, exhausted, the LEAD VAMPIRE'S H his hand dangling by its hair. He tosses the head and it rolls to Hicks' feet, fangs fla up at him. Hicks stares at the ghastly visage. Unnerved. CUT TO: Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant PYRE lights up the night, fed with the bodies of Familiars and Vampires, Priest and Hicks silhouetted agai the flames. The two are silent, grimly going about their task -- It's obvious the skirmish has affected Hicks. Priest notices. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your arm? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky I guess. The blade didn't go that deep. (fingering the bandage) Don't know what got into those Familiars to attack like that. They're usually harmless. Priest finds a KNIPE clutched in a dead Familiar's hand, tucks it in his waistband. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually. A BEAT as they listen to the popping of the fire. A tensi hanging between them. Then - HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this on purpose, didn't you? You knew we wouldn't. be out before sundown. You wanted this to happen. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have the stomach for it --head back to Haibridge right now. Hicks glares at Priest. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stomach I got. I was in the Rangers two years. Even fought in the Boondock Uprising...I saw some crazy things. HORRIBLE THINGS (SOFTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just ain't never seen anything like this. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing a vampire isn't like killing a man. They come at'you like an animal. Tooth for tooth.

dialogues.speaker: 'PRIEST, (CON'Y'' D)
dialogues.text: Claw for claw -- Blood, skin, bones. 6 They take all of it. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you let `em. Hicks studies Priest, in the firelight he looks tired. Ol even. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it comes easy to you... don't it? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killin'. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it just comes. Easy's got nothing to do with it. He pokes at the fire, it CRACKLES, feeding off the bodies Something about the battle's opened him up. His guard's d

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: I take no pleasure in it. Killing. I know I've done more than my share -- Whatever they do to me I have it coming. HICKS (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they took her because of you... don't you? Priest stands. Cracks his neck. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your gun. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your gun. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You gonna shoot me now? Priest's stare is piercing. A pause then Hicks pulls his shooter, handing it to him. Priest checks the chambers, giving it a quick spin. 0
PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't anticipate the trajectory of your target. Know it. He stomps his foot into the fire, launching a GLOWING COA ASH into the air. Priest quickly raises the gun and FIRES the ash explodes, raining fiery red sparks. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're teaching me to shoot? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm teaching you to kill vampires. No more wild shots -- HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass I In case you didn't notice I was pretty damn good out there! And I sure as hell didn't see you doin' much when I had that blade buried in my arm. (SPITS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've been too busy "focusing". Priest hands the gun back to Hicks. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always-two points. A and B. Know the points and you'll know your target. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't nothin' but a bunch of bullshit. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see ten crypts ...but only eight vampires. We find the missing, we'll find-Lucy.' What's the next nearest town? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jericho. It's clear across the Plains. Gonna be a rough ride. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you better get a good night's sleep. This bunch was easy, their bloodlines watered down by man. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever took Lucy was a whole different breed. He tosses another body on the fire, tiny sparks floating the night as --
We hear the Banshee call of a STEAM WHISTLE, sharp and sh as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A STEAM LOCOMOTIVE
dialogues.text: Bearing down like death itself, teeth of the behemoth's g leering: like a skull. Thick clouds of heavy smoke burst its blast pipe, rails SQUEALING as the train RACES past. There re no Windows, just an unblinking black juggernaut, midnight willed into.a steel and iron frame. Terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cars BLAST PAST THE CAMERA we see each is filled w rows of BLACK COFFINS. A TALL FIGURE walks between them, wearing a BLACK TOP HAT AND CAPE. We only see 12im from behind. PALE ARMS reach from within the coffins, fingers touching hem of the Figure's cape as he walks past. ГўВЂВў A FAMILIAR approaches. FAMILIAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man came on board at the last stop. Says he has something for you. The Figure nods. We-FOLLOW as he continues to the back of --- the car, sliding open the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine china on oak tables. The SNAKE OIL SALESMAN we saw b in Halbridge sits, nervously, in a plush chair. Candles light the car, casting the room in a surreal flicker.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: You told me tQ come to you if I had any information. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some. Silently, the Figure sits down across from him.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But before I tell you...and I hate to bring this, up -- there is the small matter regarding compensation. (LEANING FORWARD) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now your group's been REAL good for business so, of course, I'm willing to cut you a deal The Figure suddenly. LUNGES, grabbing the salesman by the throat, teeth clicking inches from the man's neck. WE STI DO NOT SEE HIS FACE. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can SMELL the blood racing through your veins... Smells like dinner. The salesman starts to shake.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: (VOICE QUAVERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-After you snatched that girl outside Haibridge...two nights later -- a Priest s-showed up. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Priest?

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN
dialogues.text: He was meetin' with the local sheriff. A real shitkicker -- Booted me out of town before I could make a single sell. A pause..,.and then the Figure laughs. The salesman not s how to react.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE OIL SALESMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: W-What's so funny? The Figure BURIES his teeth in the man's neck, taking a d deep drink, having his fill, dropping the body to the flo with a thud. THE CAMERA CONTINUES TO FOLLOW as the Figure walks to the back of the car, sliding open the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sliver of light lands on LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on the floor, her face streaked with tears. Vestige of the girl we met earlier already lost. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell anyone if you let me out...I promise. (MORE)
LUCY (CONT'D) (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 I won't even go to the police. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in here for your own protection...If I let you out of this car you'll be torn apart a piece at a time. He walks to her, face still hidden in shadow. She starts cry, pulling back to the wall. Angry. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle's a Priestl one of the best. Hooll corns after youl The Figure laughs. Bending down to her level -- BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm absolutely counting on it. And now we get our first look at her captor. A cross tatt h s adows his face. The mark of the Priest. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINES SCREAMING Priest and Hicks BLAZE across the playa

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: WE WATCH as the sun crests the horizon and rises quickly across the sky. Clouds whip past at incredible speeds, ti unfolding like a hallucinogenic until we're faced with -- THE PLAINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit parked on a bluff, the emptiness making Hick's e ache. A more desolate view couldn't be found in all of he HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walkin' Pete talked about this place -- said it. used to be really somethin'. Everythin' growin' green as a goddamn dollar bill. (snorts). 'Course we had to go and screw it up by poisonin' everythin' -- nothin' pretty survives this world ...nothin' decent anyways. (FROWNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wish I could'a seen it.
Priest pulls out a canteen of water, takes a sip. Hands i k7) to Hicks. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your arm? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding it from him) Sore. Cut's still open. As Hicks hands the canteen back, Priest suddenly grabs hi it's completely healed. Not even a scar. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a halfbreed. A BEAT as Hicks looks to the ground, when he speaks, it's a voice just below his breath. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandmother... she was raped. Nobody knows -- It's recessive in my family. No bloodthirst. No light sensitivity. I'm not proud... but it's a part of me. Ain't nothin' I can do. (looks at Priest) I woulda told you...just didn't want you treatin' me no different. It hangs there. the'silence stretching like a rope,then Priest REVS his cycle; a flurry ofdust kicking up as he s away. HOLD ON HICKS -- Eyes stinging, he watches Priest. Finally he starts his bike, following.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS AS -
dialogues.text: A. Priest inspects a TIRE TREAD in the sand, a cluster of clouds gathering in the sky behind him. B. A PAIR OF CRACKED BLACK GOGGLES half-buried in the dus The kind used by a motorcycle rider. C. Hicks pulls a TORN PIECE OF CLOTHING (LUCY'SDRESS?) stashed in a rock crevice, he holds it up to Priest, GUNN his engine as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest and Hicks' BARRELING through the dust. Up ahead, something materializes in the desert --

dialogues.speaker: A TIN STRUCTURE
dialogues.text: Must be a mirage. Hicks blinks, can't believe his eyes. I looks abandoned. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be a desert rat. They park their bikes about twenty feet from the rickety structure, Hicks stepping off his bike and approaching. Carefully. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do the talkin'. The sun has a way of cookin' these people's brains so they ain't quite right - BANG! A rifle shot kicks up dust at Hicks' feet.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.3.)
dialogues.text: Hold it right there, mistert Hicks freezes. A BEAT as. the front of the shack shows only a doorway hi in shadow...thenan OLD MAN emerges, Rifle in hand. He COC it, making a bead for Hick's head. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take another step and you'll be meetin' the Lord directly. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy now old timer. I'm a sheriff. The old man snorts, spitting a thick stream of tobacco,. sizzles when it hits the dust. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no law out here but my own. Calm and cool, Priest shifts in his seat, drawing his gaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Priest clearly now for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Praise The Lord. Total attitude adjustment. He lowers the Rifle and smiles revealing a gap tooth smile wide enough to drive a herd o cattle through. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dusty PHONOGRAPH playing a recording of an old-time spiritual, the record warped from the heat, distorting th voice as THE CAMERA PANS PAST hundreds of homemade CRUCIF haphazardly nailed across the wall. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaned the place up a bit. Been years since I had any kind of company 'sides jackrabbits but I knew you was comity' -- Dreams don't lie.' Ignoring Hicks, the old man pours BLACK TEA into a rusty handing it to Priest.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CON'S I D)
dialogues.text: Most people don't remember what you folk done -- Don' t WANT to remember. But I do. I know what you can do. (making the sign of the cross) You are God's mighty sword fused into flesh. One of the chosen.. Touched by His very ha nd so peace could finally come to this cur sed land. Hicks snorts. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a bunch of religious mumbo jumbo to me. The old man stares fixedly at Priest. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you tell the Clergy this here is an authentic miracle, I want it registered. It's mine. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miracle?
OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Angels. Never seen so many loot souls, breaks my heart just to think of it. This ain't no place for nothin' divine. The man's fevered belief unsettles Priest, he's unsure ho respond. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw angels? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure as chit. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know, too many to count. Hundreds. Thousands. Some nights the sky was so thick you couldn't see the stars. His eyes suddenly light up, remembering something. i OLD MAN (CONT'D) Here! Look at this -- He goes to a shelf, it's been turned into a MAKESHIFT SHR rw=ging through a jumbled collection of crucifixes, yello photographs, collected junk. He pulls out a GLASS JAR containing SOMETHING MISSHAPEN floating in murky water, the old man proudly showing it t Priest and Hicks. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's their spoor! They'd be flyin' above and this stuff would drop from the sky like manna. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's angel shit? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooped it up myself. (offering it to Hicks) You wanna hold it? Hicks backs away, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Priest still doesn't know what to make of the man but he senses something to be gained. He tries changing the subj PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These angels...di.d you ever see them during the day? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I reckon'. that's when they'd go back home for some shut eye -- Gettin' the world ready for the rapture takes a lot of work. Praise God. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle - .:,He:points out the window, far away, atop a craggy peak the -remains of a CASTLE --

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beautiful place. Wonder of the world. I used to watch `em every night, takin' to the sky in all of God's glory, (LEANS FORWARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never would disturb `em though. God's children like their privacy. He winks, smiling that crazy smile. Priest considers the possibility of a lead here -- but Hicks just gazes at the man like he's nuts as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys mounting up their bikes, about to head out. The approaches Priest. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I want you to have somethin' before you go He presses a HOMEMADE CROSS into Priest's hand. It's a re beauty, flecked with colored stones. A lot of love and ca went into this one.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: Remember, a man comes into this world with one thing. His soul. He's lucky if he's still got it when he leaves. Priest pockets the cross, REVVING his cycle and with a fi nod -- he and Hicks speed into the wasteland. The old man watches, his cracked face squinting as the sun flashes of the metal of the machines. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire train shooting down the track, blown tumblewe catching the scrub brush as it races by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is on her knees, scratching her nails against the wo floor. Testing it. Splintery shards come up in tiny clust From outside,.:the sound of a padlock opening, a chain dropping to the floor. Lucy quickly sits, making innocent A SERVANT FAMILIAR enters, carrying a tray of food, his e grotesquely roam Lucy's body. Lucy smiles sweetly, taking the tray. LUCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The Familiar turns to leave. WHAPI Lucy SLAMS the tray over his head and he collapses the floor. She makes a run for it. But the Familiar manages to grab ankle.knocking her down, she kicks at him as he holds fas hissing. Two more FAMILIARS run in and grab her arms, wrestling he the floor.
