She struggles furiously but it's no use, she screams as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad collection of crumbling stone walls and turrets. Al more surreal for rising up in the absolute nothing of the wasteland. Г‚ВЂВў
Priest and Hicks stand, surveying the ancient ruin. Hicks can't help but laugh. HICKS (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Truly a wonder of the world...good thing we listened to the fossil. Don't know how we'd find Lucy without him. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires sometimes use abandoned structures as a perch. (looks at Hicks) Watch for booby traps. And with that he enters the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desert shrubs sprout like weeds between the stones, once proud turrets rotting to dust, everything bleached by the weather. Whatever this place was -- the desert owns it no HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why we listen' to that crackpot? Crazy fucker's so blinded by faith he's batahit. That's called a zealot in my. book. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm startin' to think you might be one yourself. You ever think bout that? Priest doesn't respond, squinting his eyes. At the opposite end of the courtyard is an opening. It leads into a CHAMBER of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musty. Cool. Dark. Walls rising high into a cone as sunlight streams in from an opening in the top. Hicks and Priest enter, stepping carefully over PILES OF (GARBAGE littering the floor. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. Lucy's been gone five days'-- every stupid minute we waste here is a minute more she gets farther-away. Priest turns and sees a STONE STAIRCASE, uneven steps lea downwards...too dark to tell where though.
PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. If anything comes up the steps that isn't me -- Shoot it. Before Hicks can reply,.Priest heads down the stairs, dar swallowing him with every step. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: The air seems thicker here, the darkness claustrophobic. Enveloping. It takes a moment for Priests' eyes to adjust A CATACOMB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually more a cave. Miles and miles. Twisting, jagged a moist. Endless corners, weaving into a dark and hideous m Priest heads into it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Hicks kicks at the garbage. There's something underneath. He brushes aside the refuse, uncovering a . bunch' of SMA WHITE SHAPES, breath catching as he realizes what it is: Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet. Priest moves through the darkness, footsteps not even a whisper, heading deeper and deeper into the labyrinth as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks is now at the chamber wall,'running his hand along feels grooves lining its surface. Stepping back, he sees they form an image-of some kind. H to make it out in the darkness. He leafs through the garbage, pulling out a piece of BROK GLASS AS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest turns a jagged corner and looks down the longest, narrow tunnel yet. A light shines at the end. A TORCH. Flickering gently. A SHADOW brushes past the light, moving so fast it barely registers. Could just be a trick of the eye. Or not. Priest moves towards it.

dialogues.speaker: IT. CASTLE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Hicks angles the broken glass under the light, reflecting faint beam onto the wall, revealing a HUGE CARVING cut in THE STONE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1L0Z.J.PIf .! i Primitive but very creepy. We linger on the image, the terror of the people, the viciousness of the creature. Tr horrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Just the low how], of a breeze moving through the tunnel. Priest walks into an ANIMAL PEN of sorts, a hay-like substance covering the floor, the smell of something best He,covers his nose, looking around, something in the corn catching his eye --- TWO BODIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: splayed across the ground like rag dolls. He crouches to take a closer look...

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: SOMETHING. barrels into him with superhuman force! Acting on instinct, Priest FOLDS AND ROLLS. Kicking the thing off him and PUSHING off the wall for a blistering recovery. Whatever it is, it's fast. Quickly countering for every m he gives, neither able to get the upper hand. Too dark to make out what it is. Priest locks his arms around the shape's arms, SLAb24=G i against the wall, illuminating it under the torch light.

o A BEAT as they stand staring at each other, unsure what say. The cross tattoo covers her face, shadowing fierce eyes. Every inch a warrior. Time seems to stop for these two. Their whole dark histor their bend -- passing between them in one glance. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find me? Priest doesn't reply. She narrows her eyes, suspicious. PRIESTESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the Clergy send you? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they? She nods towards the bodies, we now see tb=1re.-VAMPIRZ- CORPSES. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been busy. Off Priest's reaction we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks looking up to see the light; from the hole in the geilingwinkinc_out. The sun is setting. Slipping, he drops the piece og glass, cutting his finger Drawing blood. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He wipes the blood on his pants, not noticing as a A LARG SHAPE looms in the archway behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two warriors eye each other, the. air heavy between t PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you didn't come for me...why are you here? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be asking you the same question.
The bestial smell stings their nostrils, smells good. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another one around here somewhere. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...but it's not like the others. They're interrupted by the sound of GUNFIRE echoing off t tunnel walls. Priest turns. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks. He starts down the tunnel. The Priestess quickly followin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks is sprawled at the base of the stairs, bloodied and bruised. Both guns pointed at

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP OF THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: SOMETHING is lurking. A hulking shadow, sounds like a rab bull. We catch the TIP OF A CLAW scraping at the stone fl Priest approaches from down the tunnel, senses on full al PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too big to fit down here. That's why you're still alive. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that thing?I HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid. Vampires don't look like that.

dialogues.speaker: PRIESTESS, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: They used to. The Priestess steps out from behind Priest. Startling Hic
HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?! (7, She doesn't even bother to respond,.just shooting a look the two warriors bound

dialogues.speaker: UP THE STEPS
dialogues.text: Charging into battle. Priest BURSTS from the stairway LEAPING up and over as the Priestess rolls off to the sid He-lands beside her, the two turning to face down -- THE VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fearsome creature -- much more terrifying than the Nightshade variety. Bigger, more ferocious. The ancient cousin to the more modern vampire. The beast opens its mouth and lets loose with a SCREAM, i breath vile. THE PRIESTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Split up. The Priestess LEAPING to the stone wall and climbing up the rock. Priest goes the opposite way, ROLLI across the floor, keeping low. I THE VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a screech, goes for the Priestess. Crawling up the w hunched like a rat, talons ferociously . digging, into: r Coordinating an attack wordlessly, the Priests make their THE PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets go of the wall, PLUMMETING straight towards the vamp the creature FLASHING its fangs in anticipation. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaps from below, darting up the rock, taking advantage o the distraction, landing on the creature's back and wrapp his arms around its neck. Going for the deathlock. With a SHRIEK the creature WHIPS its head with crack forc sending Priest flying. The Priestess, still in mid-drop, CATCHES him and they both hit the ground with their feet. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we lead it into open air? More room to. maneuver.
PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to keep it contained. The vampire's lathered into an animal frenzy now, wailing scuttling around the circular wall in crazy patterns. Suddenly -- with a stone shattering BOOM! it BURSTS throu the hole, FLYING out into the night. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or not. They race outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priests look up to find the vampire clawed around a turret, shadowed in the moonlight. WHOOSH!. Great leathery wings unfold from its back as it SWOOPS low, coming in for the'kill. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darts behind a boulder just in time. The creature's talon SCRAPING at the rock before it soars back to the sky, He pulls out his bible, grabbing and tossing a handful of THROWING CROSSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUTTING through the air, sparkling in the moonlight, beautiful. BUT They BOUNCE harmlessly off the creature's wings, knifing to the ground, imbedding deep in the stone, Priest having nimbly: dodge his own weaponry. THE CREATURE HOWLS! Blazing straight for him. Undaunted. Priest looks at the Priestess and folds his ha into the prayer position, leveling his breath, pulse slow as the screaming beast bares down like a freight train! THE PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly scoops up TWO LARGE ROCKS -- HURTLING them toward the vampire. HER EYES LOCK WITH PRIEST'S as she too folds her hand, into the prayer position. RY ГўВЂВћNG GOES BLACK Silence. Then --
The sound of a heartbeat. The juncture between instants. A fissure. A BRIGHT FLASH -- we see Priest LEAPING through the air - EVERYTHING AROUND HIM FROZEN -- the creature, the rocks, Priestess.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYTHING GOES BI CK
dialogues.text: A BRIGHT FLASH again -- and now Priest is using the froze rocks as STEPS -- LAUNCHING his body until he is above th CREATURE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГЇВїВЅ1ГЇВїВЅ_ M, .Q A BRIGHT FLASH again -- and now Priest is ON the behemoth pulls out the FAMILIAR'S KNIFE, twirling it in his hand - EVERYTHING GOES BLACx And WHAM1 we fuse back into real time as the creature CRA to the ground. Its DECAPITATED HEAD rolling to a stop, fa frozen in a horrible rictus. A BEAT O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the world seems to hold its breath then -- Priest lands in a crouch, dropping next to the Priestess, hands still locked in the prayer position. She turns to h PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. Suddenly the CREATURE'S BODY erupts into ablistering deat spasm! Talons clacking like STRAIGHT RAZORS, flailing dangerously close to the two of them. BAMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single bullet. pierces its heart and the body collapses a THUD. Once and for all -- dead. ANGLE ON HICKS in the archway, smoke coming off his gun. looks at the Priests. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point A...meet point fuckin' B. He smiles, twirling his six shooters back into their hols CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks examining the fallen creature, poking at the carcas with his gun. In some crazy, distant way he's related to this thing. He raises his hand, comparing it to the beast's talon. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE CASTLE WALL
dialogues.text: Priest and the Priestess stare out at the Wasteland, uncomfortable with looking at each other. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a Pureblood. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we both know that's impossible -- They haven't existed for a millennium. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I don't know. A BEAT filled with awkward silence -- when the Priestess ktГЇВїВЅ speaks it comes as a relief for both. An unloose things long held tight. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sector Seven was the only place I could find work. Waste Management. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody else would hire me. %No applicable skills.& PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that one too. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week ago, a family camping out on the Perimeter approached me --.Told me vampires were terrorizing their village and that the government wouldn't do anything about it. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go to The Clergy? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't see me, (LOOKS DOWN) (MORE)
PRIESTESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time I got to the village it was completely razed. Nothing left. Women. Children. All dead ...they didn't even bother to feed. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been on their trail ever since...could be the same group who took your niece. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be. The Priestess glances towards Hicks. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the lawman know what you'll do if you find her? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll try to stop you. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't be able to. She pauses a moment, regarding him. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, some nights I still dream we're back on the frontlines ... I wake up, I'm sweating... my muscles all clenched like I'm ready for something -- But I don't know what. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nights like that ...I don't go back to sleep. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But on other nights ...the good nights I dream about other things. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..Like what? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Priest stares at her, not sure what to say. Lucky for him the moment gets interrupted by --
HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting from below) - Hey.you guys better get a look at thisl The warriors lock eyes, knowing something's been started but.unsure of what. They head down the stone steps. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Hicks is lifting up one of the creature's wings. There's some sort of BLACK MARK on its skin. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it must be a birthmark of some kind. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't no birthmark -- it's a brand. The Priestess studies the mark, something about it making skin crawl. Maybe because it's in'theshape of a top hat. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else you need to see... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a torch, the Priestess. leads Priest and Hicks through the maze, the deeper they go the more subterranea feels. Bowels of the earth. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this just before I was attacked -

dialogues.speaker: AN UNDERGROUND CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Huge. Cavernous. Our group appearing as tiny shapes set against the awesome scale of the place. Hundreds of LARGE HOLES gouged into the walls, stretching as far as torchli allows. An incredible sight. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tomb. Big enough for an army. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they're not as endangered as everyone thought. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: A HICKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 But where'd they go?. We hear a LOUD SHRIEK - and a MASSIVE SWARM OF BATS sweep through the depths of the chamber, black wings fluttering PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our group moving deeper into the dark cavern, a moan of w echoing off the gorge wail behind them, massive black stalactites hanging overhead. Very creepy. They move quickly, Priest ahead of the other two. Hicks gazes at the Priestess, admiring her body. Any man would. He works up his courage and approaches her. Quietly. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are Priests allowed to, you know...have relations? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take a vow of celibacy at inception. Hicks can't be sure -- did she just look at Priest when s said that? HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...I was uh, wondering --. how did he do that little stunt back there? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Priests can do it. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including you? She nods. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the trick? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trick. You just have to remember. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember... what? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is relative.
Priest snaps up his hand, cutting off their conversation, something strange up ahead -- He slowly moves forward, th tunnel sharply dropping, feeding into a -- HUGE CHAMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like the cave, this is more earthen. Like the inside wasp nest, curved walls made of dirt and spit, Priest cov his nose and mouth as he's hit with a massive stench.

dialogues.speaker: A GIANT SHADOW
dialogues.text: Looms before him, we_don't see what it is. As the Priestess and Hicks enter the chamber, Hicks cough reeling from the smell, the Priestess wrapping a cloth ar her mouth -- the CAMERA focusing only on theirexpressions they take in the horrible spectacle before them. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said the next nearest town was Jericho. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we better go see. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . See what? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What they left of it. PUSH IN ON HICKS -- knots of rope tightening in his stomach... only now realizing how truly black the path be him will be. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NIGHT TRAIN thundering across the rails, almost obsce in the bright sunlight. An intruder from the darkness We hear a SCRATCHING sound, something scraping. Heavy breathing as we MOVE INTO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SERVANT FAMILIAR slides the door open, carrying food Lucy, no tray this time.

But she's not there. He SCREECHES, dropping the-food as he runs to a HOLE ripp the wood floor, smatterings of blood around the edges. It not very big, just enough for a small body to fit through The Familiar sticks his head through the opening and -,- RAILROAD TRACKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLACK past at a furious speed, inches from his head! The noise is deafening..

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey... The Familiar turns -- Lucy's perched inside one of the JO lining the underside of the train. KRACKI- She lets loose with a well-placed KICK, snapping head back so he catches on the track. With ascream, he's quickly SUCKED out the train, pulverized on the track. Lucy's covers her mouth, her nails an ugly bloody mass. She's come this far, time to go the rest. She manages to carefully crawl from joist to joist, movin along the underside of the train, her body just centimete from the passing track. OHB SLIPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catching herself just in time. Her eyelids practically brushing the wood. Taking a deep breath, she manages to hoist herself throug the rest of the way finally making it to the CABOOSE. She pulls herself up onto the back of the car. Now what? train is blazing past the wasteland at an incredible spee Only one thing to do. She makes the sign of the cross, closes her eyes and JUMP

dialogues.speaker: EXT WASTELAND, (EDGE OF THE PLAINS)
dialogues.text: A dustorm. The plain's a shifting veil of sand, parting to reveal a vista of dunes, wind shipping across them.

As quickly as it opened the veil closes again, shifting t reveal OUR TRIO plowing through, blast goggles and respirators covering their faces. The Priestess riding a cycle identical to Priest's. In the distance we can make out a cluster of structures a they arrive at Jericho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding into town. The storm making it difficult to see anything as they idle onto main street. It's deserted -- only sound a saloon door creaking noisily in the wind. Ominous signs left in the vampires' wake are everywhere - BROKEN DOORS, SHATTERED WINDOWS, OVERTURNED VEHICLES. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We separate. Go through each building, see what we find. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll start with the sheriff. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Just because it's daylight doesn't mean it's safe. Hicks nods, tightening the twin BANDOLEERS across his che

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JAIL DAY
dialogues.text: Everything is eerily quiet, just the sound of the wind. Hicks crouches just outside the door, examining SPENT SHE CASINGS littering the walkway. He pulls out his six-shoot pushing the door open with his gun, stepping inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a mess. DUST BLOWN IN FROM THE STORM COVERS EVERYTHING, broken furniture scattered everywhere, glass littering the floor Whatever went down here -- someone put up a hell of a fig HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Damn. He shakes his head, heading towards the holding area as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priestess walks in, flurries of yellow dust swirling her wake, filling the room. if the jail was a disaster zone, this place is just plain creepy. Red sofas, red curtains, hell, even red wine. Everything set up for a great time...just no people. A PIANO sits nestled in the corner, she walks to it and r her finger across the dust covered keys. It comes up wet and red. Blood.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC SUDDENLY BURSTS FROM THE PIANO
dialogues.text: The plinking keys playing by themselves, activated by pneumatic pegs on a rotating paper roll, filling the lone room with tin-pan music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a record skipping. Priest steps through a doorway, the door already ripped o its hinges. Broken furniture and glass. It's obvious a FAMILY lived here, children's clothes and wooden toys messily strewn across the floor. He walks to an OLD PHONOGRAPH sitting on the windowsill, still playing, placing the needle back in its cradle. That's when so=thing out the window ratchgo hiseve...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JERICHO/MAIN STREET DAY
dialogues.text: Hicks, done searching, meets up with the Priestess in the middle of the street, he's pretty disturbed. Wind howling around him. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ain't nobody left. Nobody. PRIESTESS (OMINOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many mouths to feed. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Priest?
But the Priestess's already focused on something else, ga at something behind the general store. He turns to see wh it is. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground KNEELING. Head down, engaging in some kind prayer. THE CAMERA FOLLOWS as they slowly approach, wondering wha the hell is going on. As they get closer they see the ful PICTURE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Priest are THREE LARGE WOODEN CROSSES, A NAKED BOD EACH, crucified. Because of the swirling sand it's hard t make out their faces but it's obvious the poor souls are already dead. Immediately the Priestess drops beside Priest, joining hi And it is only now that we get a good look at the crucifi FACES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Priests. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare feet running on the salt-flats. It's Lucy. Covered in dirt, battered and bruised but chugging along. There is absolutely NOTHING out here, onl LUCY AND

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK FIGURE DROPS SILENTLY FROM THE SKY BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: it wears a BLACK COAT, fluttering in the wind as it touch down, the fabric cascading across the earth in long dark The Figure's face is completely covered by a BLACK COWBOY HAT. The only thing we can see is a CHEROOT Sticking out from where the mouth would be. A brief moment as the tip of the cigar glows, a puff of s exhaled. It drops to the ground, silver spurs making a slight CHING sound as a BLACK BOOT stamps it out. Lucy hears the sound and turns just in time to see - y I ATHICK CHAIN __SHOOTING OUT from within the Fiaure', coat. a HUGE METAL_ FINGERED CLAW at use ! The claw SLAMS into Lucy, thick fingers CLAMPING around her, knocking he THE GROUND

She digs her nails into the earth but it's no use as the DRAGS her backwards and she quickly-disappears INTO the c with a SCREAM. The folds enveloping her in a dark embrace In one graceful sweep, the Black Figure leaps to the sky. Quickly disappearing. We see the cheroot on the ground. Spent. The only evidenc that anyone or anything was ever out here at all. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught between sheets of swirling dust and.sand, the imag like hallucinations, moments of ritual and grief -- A. The crucified Priests taken down from their crosses, their naked bodies like ragdolls. B. The corpses now wrapped in white cloth, carefully plac amongst the makeshift pyre. C. Flames engulfing the bodies, a twisty column of smoke rising, the sun and clouds painting the sky pink and gold OUR TRIO stands before the pyre gazing into the fire, it consuming more of the bodies, if the Priests listen close enough they can hear the end of an era. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make no sense. What were they doin' out here? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing as us. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's drawing us out. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? The Priests just stare into the fire, not having any idea HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine you'll have to go back to the Cities, inform the Clergy. A sudden silence. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going back.
The Priestess looks at him, he speaks for her as well but she's still shocked to hear the words out loud. A lifetim of conditioning.. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll burn for this. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the pyre) We already are. Something in the flames catches the Priestess's eye, in t charred remains of one of the corpses -- SOMETHING'S GLOW She wraps her arm, plunging her hand through the bones, pulling out the object. Quickly, she tosses it into a'bar of water. it hisses, steam rising as it cools. Priest reaches into the barrel, his hand emerging with a METAL SPIKE. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a railroad spike. My pop used to work boxcars before they shut down -- Why the hell would anyone wanna swallow that? A beat as Priest puts it together. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted us to find it. It's a clue. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the closest track? CUT TO.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JAIL DAY
dialogues.text: Hicks pulls a LARGE MAP off the wall, blowing off a layer dust, drawing a line across the paper with his finger. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dunkirk Line. It starts all the way in the backcountry, bought the ore from the deep mines. There were about five stops along the route. I think. He draws several Xs along the line. His hand coming to a stop on a particular forboding PATCH OF MOUNTAINS.
HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Jericho was, the last town it glances before'. heading around the Linwood Mountains...Then it goes to the last stop. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? He draws one final X at the end of the line. Looks up. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cities. So there it is. The Priestess narrows her eyes. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have been picking up different factions along the way. Moving during the day, feeding at night. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But headin' to the Cities is suicide. The sun will kill `em -- there's nowhere to hide. Priest gazes at the map, deeply troubled. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't have to. And with the SHRIEK of the train whistle we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Night Train barreling down the track, blasting along its grim trajectory. Suddenly -- THE CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overtakes the train. Snaking along the rail at an incredi speed, leaving the train in its tracks (sorry) as it blis across the Wasteland through craggy mountains and finally ending up in THE CITIES. And it is only now that we see exactly what Priest means. THICK CLOUD OF INDUSTRIAL SMOKE covers the metropolis. There is no sun. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK COWBOY HAT coolly tilted down, exposing .a cheroo clutched between thin lips. A trail of smoke lazily float upwards. DARK FIGEMH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine catch yes? (the voice is oily, a dark WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd be dead if not for me...swallowed by the wasteland. We see Lucy on the floor at the Figure's feet, his pale h runs calmly through her hair. From the shadows, Black Hat steps forward, looking down a Lucy. She struggles but the hand tightens its grip. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want for her? And now her captor lifts his hat -- revealing paper-thin skin, eyes like black coal. This is RUNE, a bounty hunter RUNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what r want. Black Hat's eyes flick upwards, glinting in the. candleli BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. go too far, Rune. RUNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes for her still. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he does. RUNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me have him. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Rune smiles,'revealing an impressive set of vampire fangs RUNE'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she'll fetch a nice price out In the zone -- they don't care what condition their meat's in...as long as it's easy to chew.
Black Hat eyes him. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get involved in this. RUNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was involved long before you showed up. (SEETHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting years for a chance at him...and now that he's here I find x have to ask a Prime permission... Like a snake, a finger of the claw emerges from the folds his jacket, wrapping itself around Lucy's neck. RUNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My how things have changed. Ever so slightly, the metal finger SQUEEZES Lucy's throat choking her. RUNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never cared about your war. Never got Involved. Us halfbreeds. We were exiles -- rejected by both humans and vampires. All we wanted was a quiet place. But he wiped out my whole tribe. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to return the favor. The metal finger wraps TIGHTEtR, Lucy gasps, the "tension becoming unbearable until finally BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. He's Yours. As if on command, the finger retreats back into the jacke Lucy COLLAPSING to the floor coughing and choking. RUNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And -- she's yours. He laughs, sounds like a death rattle, dropping the cigar the floor, spurs chiming as he walks out the car door, lo dark coat fluttering behind him, disappearing into the ni BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, picks up the still burning cigar, squeezing it i his hand. He turns to Lucy.
BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as for you uy dear...You're more trouble than I anticipated. Must be your uncle's blood in you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shame he'll never see what you'll become. I would've loved to see his face. And then he is upon her, saliva mixing with blood as he d CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROAR1 Our trio plow through the scrubby desert growth, ch up the dirt. The blood of their machines at full boil..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VAMPIRE TRAIN chugging along on its dark course, head for the Cities. ГЇВїВЅOur'crew hellbent on stopping `em. The two locked o path, blurring across the landscape as the sun crests acr the sky DISSOLVING INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twilight. Hicks and the two Priests ride past tumbleweed drifts, th surrounding desertscape golden in the fading light. Ahead a forboding series of CRAGGY MOUNTAINS, awaits, a WINDING TRAIL criss-crossing through the peaks. They stop, their machines idling next to each other, taki stock of the huge task _beГўВ‚В¬ore' them. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beggar's Pass...it ain't gonna be easy. As if on cue the last rays of the sun wink out behind the mountain.
Headlight crossbeams leading the way, their cycles naviga the twisty trail, cutting across sheer canyon walls, teet on the brink of an abyss, rock slides a constant threat. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've set up camp for the night on the lip of a ridge. Hicks and the Priestess sit by a fire dunking their feet nearby stream, the wear and tear of their journey evident the sheriff's face. Priest lies close by, asleep. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we push it hard we'll gain two days on 'em. Should be enough to get us a jump. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'need more than a jump. We need a miracle. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the funny thing about time -- He dips his hand in the water and raises it, letting the liquid leak from between his fingers. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always runin' right through my fingers. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should try harder, sheriff. She cups her hand in the water, bringing it to her lips f drink. Hicks smiles, leaning forward, something on his mi HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever regret it? Bein' a Priest? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a husband, children...A family? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a family -- just not the kind you're familiar with.
Hicks glances at Priest. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You mean Mr. Laffs over there? PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not so bad once you get to know him. A beat, Hick's expression becoming serious. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill her, isn't he? If. she's turned. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's things that can be done. She doesn't have to die. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's his bloodline... and he's a Priest. It's the only way. Hicks tosses the rest of his food into the fire, troubled but he knows there's no point in discussing it any further... for now. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how many of you Priests are left now? A long moment before she speaks. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. Hicks doesn't know what to Say-,, HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I'm sorry., PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She nods, though in affirmation of what Hicks's isn't sur He watches her as she stares'into the fire. We FADE TO BL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark.

A GROUP OF PRIESTS (OUR TWO amongst them) move silently through a DEEP TRENCH, moist earthen walls rising around them, the air putrid with stink, mud clinging to their fe Last: in the line, is a particularly FEARSOME PRIEST ...u the others, he's smiling, enjoying the action. As a cohesive unit, the Priests, climb up from the trench scaling through the muck. They find themselves at the bas of the hive, looking around at a chilling sight --

dialogues.speaker: THOUSANDS OF HONEYCOMBS
dialogues.text: stretching endlessly, rising high above in a cone. THOUSA OF SLEEPING VAMPIRES. OUR PRIEST, motions with his hand to the others, giving precise instructions, their movements well coordinated. He stops. Hearing a sound...a faint but incr. A BEAT as the Priestess looks at the others. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know we're here. From under the earth A HAND SHOOTS UP, grabbing onto a Priest's leg, pulling him down. Suddenly DOZENS OF VAMPIR emerge, seemingly birthed from the soil. The warriors fig valiantly. Fiercely. But it's too much. Most are quickly cut down. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retreat! FEARSOME PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battles like a tiger, grappling with TWo VAMPIRES, their at his throat, fangs inches from his face. A couple of qu moves and - before you realize how - the vanires lay dead He quickly joins the surviving Priests as they run throug hive, a dizzying maze of MUDDY TUNNELS AND TRENCHES.

dialogues.speaker: FEARSOME SUDDENLY STOPS
dialogues.text: A BLACK TOP HAT lying on the ground catching his eye, mus the last remanent of a dandy gentleman. He picks it up, admiring the souvenir. Puts it on his head. The Priestess races by, shooting him a we don't have time for this' look. He STOPS her, grabbing her shoulder
FEARSOME PRIEST (WINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think -- Am I a "Dapper Dan"? She glares, running ahead to join the group. Fearsome jus smiles, taking off the hat.

dialogues.speaker: FEARSOME PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess not. From within the hive comes a MIGHTY SHRIEK -- and now Fearsome starts to run, trying to catch the others as the scramble for daylight. The exit just in sight. At the last second -- He's pulled back by a clutch of SCREECHING HUNGRY CLAWS. hat still gripped tightly in his hand as he's dragged awa our two Priests reach for him but it's too late ...He disappears into the darkness as we CUT BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest WAKING UP, breath catching in his throat. He looks over to find the Priestess working on her cycle, unable to sleep. There's a tension in the air, the sense something about to break as he joins her. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would the Clergy forbid us from seeing each other? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they were scared of what we could do. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what we would do. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know there's something inside the Order that's off. Even if we don't know what it is. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With or without the Clergy...we're still Priests. And we're the only ones who can stop that train. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we survive this we need to expose them for what they are.
PRIEST (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won' t survive this. She puts down her tools, staring fixedly at him. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared to die?_ PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believed in Heaven my whole life. Believed everything we were taught -- And now...when it's finally my time...no more faith. They took it away from me. Priest gazes at her, trying his best to be comforting. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happens. .. Wherever it is we go. We'll go together. At that.exact moment something inside Priest shifts just little bit, a door opens -- never to be shut again. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in greater than God but more evil than the Devil? The poor have it, the rich need it -- and if you eat it...you'lldie. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a riddle. The Priestess thinks about it. PRIESTESS. Nothing. That's the answer. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is greater than God. Nothing is more evil than the devil. The poor have nothing, the rich need nothing. And if you eat nothing... you'll die. It's said that warriors can become close friends only whe see each other's hearts -- Priest now knows this to be tr
-PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you said before...about those nights when you were dreaming of me -- PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good nights. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The good nights. Do you think maybe tonight... PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be one of those nights? She smiles. And then Priest does the most amazing thing. . .he smiles Things happen fast -- He finds himself planting his mouth hers... the years of conditioning, all the ritual and tradition falling away in a flash. And it is here, together in this place, where they feel l they finally truly belong. The last two. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEGGAR'S PASS, DAWN
dialogues.text: A blanket of mist covers everything in a grey haze. Morni has come.

dialogues.speaker: A QUICK SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: As our trio forges onward and upward, the trail more treacherous with every twisty ridge, the overhangs loomin ominously as they head deeper into the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final climb. Yawning crevices, the wind moaning as it whistles between canyon walls. Carefully they ride across DEVIL'S BRIDGE, a finger of st just wide enough for the cycles, on either side a straigh drop to, oblivion. The peak of the mountain Just ahead.
The Priestess is in front leading the charge, closely followed by Hicks. Priest brings up the rear, he stops ju past the bridge, looks around. Something's wrong. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I- ee itl Hicks points, reaching the top of the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: A long black line snakes along the rail, puffs of heavy s lining its path; The Night Train. They're ahead of it. Barely. In his excitement, Hicks thunders ahead, starting the des down the other side. The Priestess turns to shout back to Priest. But he's gone. Off her reaction we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall rock walls flank Priest on. either side, the surroun mist hanging in the air in cloudlike wisps. Slowly he wal through the canyon, senses fully attuned. It's quiet. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're there. A slight sound, the mist whipping into a pool as if somet just moved through it. Priest quickly turns but there's nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF ROCKS
dialogues.text: Tumble down the cliff. Again Priest abruptly turns but...still nothing there. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show yourself. A BEAT as he stands in the ether, waiting. Then -- WHOOSH! Qurye -M onen. ieadjna straight-for pi=. 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in time -- he DIVES, the claw BITING into a rock beh him, the chain quickly snapping back, disappearing into t

dialogues.speaker: RU11TE, (O. S.)
dialogues.text: (voice like the mist itself) I've waited a long time for this Priest. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the time to settle old scores, Rune.

dialogues.speaker: RUNE, (0. S.)
dialogues.text: I disagree... This is the perfer, time. WOOSH! Like lightning, the claw LASHES out, appearing fro nowhere. Priest JUMPS and it CHOMPS into the ground where was standing. He lands on top of the chain, backflipping it retracts back. Gearing up for another attack. RUNE (0.s.) (CONT'D) You've lost a step Priest...I never came this close before. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm older now. We can almost bear Rune smile.

dialogues.speaker: RUNE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Not me. And now THE CHAIN comes from a different direction, WRAPP around Priest like a snake, the metal cutting into his bo snapping a ribt Yelling, Priest GRABS the chain, PULLING with everything got. Rune flies from the mist, dragged by Priest, crashin at his feet. The chain SNAPS and Priest BREAKS from the coils, grabbing Rune by the jacket, picking him up. Rune flashes his fangs and scissors his legs across Pries stomach, the razor sharp roweled SPURS slicing his flesh, tearing the muscle, Priest SCREAMS, a hot rush of, blood staining the desert floor. Rune leaps away, landing ontop a boulder. RUNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't outrun the past, Priest... the things you did. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a war, Rune.
RUNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It still is He launches at Priest, duster fluttering like wings. The grapple, Rune's fangs brushing Priest's neck. It's a savage battle, Priest's muscles and laser-like foc the only thing keeping him alive as Rune flies back acros the canyon, landing against the rock wall like.a spider. Hunched, ready to strike BUT -- THE PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears from within the mist, already in mid-leap, she la beside Priest. The two together, a formidable presence. But Rune's a tough customer, he readies himself for anoth attack. ough h2 mist a single CLICKING sound. Rune looks over, sees -- HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-shooter pointed right at him. 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as the two sides stare at each other in standoff. air between them vibrating with energy. Crackling. Rune considering his options.

dialogues.speaker: RUNE, (CONP' D)
dialogues.text: (HISSING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time, Priest. He skitters up the rock face, disappearing into the mist.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: Hicks fires a single shot, the echo ringing through the c RUNE'S BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drops from the fog, hitting the ground with a thud. Dead. And now Hicks turns -- points his revolver at Priest. Catching both he and the Priestess by surprise. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you won't kill her. Priest doesn't reply.
HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me...or I'll shoot you where you stand. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally showing your true colors. A beat. The Priestess looks at Hicks. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a halfbreed. Hicks cocks the gun. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't turn this into somethin' it's not. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been itching to do this since Nightshade. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your kin, goddamit! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if she's turned...she's nobody's kin. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things can be done. Things to lessen the thirst. She can have a normal life, she doesn't have to die. Priest nods grimly. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our way. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that? Some special Priest code of honor? You don't get it. Your "way' -- It's over! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot me and it won't matter if you find Lucy. You won't stop that train -- and you won't save her. The Priestess steps between them, looks at Hicks.
PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. We need to be together on this... it's the only shot we have. Hicks thinks about it, knows she's right. A tense beat th HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't done. He lowers his gun and walks away. The two warriors stand together, the Priestess gazing at Priest...hedoesn't return it. Without a word, he heads back to his cycle. She doesn't see as his hand touches his stomach. It comes up red. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trio BLAST down the rock face, descending down the mo at a furious clip. The Priestess looks at the train off i distance, it's now much closer, passing the mountain. They've lost their edge. HICKS C'MONL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GUNS the throttle and his bike BLAZES forward, wheels thundering across the earth, the ROAR of engines filling head becoming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mad CLATTER of the train as it barrels down the track

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEGGAR'S PASS DAY
dialogues.text: The assault begins. Our trio finishes their descent, BLASTING onto the SALT FLATS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wheels kicking up sheets of sand and grit, spattering the faces. The train dead in their sites.
HICKS (SHOUTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they see us? As if in response the locomotive belches a thick cloud of .black smoke, a door sliding open from one of the cars. A BEAT as everyone holds their breath, wondering what's g to emerge -- VR0000000000MI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIX BLACK MOTORCYCLES (the same ones who kidnapped Lucy) out from within the car! Vampires covered in rider leathe protected from the sun, heads obscured by BLAST HELMETS. Priest turns to the other two. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you get on that train, (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch up. 'Before they can respond, he banks his cycle to the left.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAMPIRE RIDERS
dialogues.text: Take the bait, going for Priest. They gun their cycles, engines.WHINING as they rev forward, their LEADER unleash a chain, swirling it above his head. With a SNAP he lashes it at Priest, the chain catching in wheel, the sound of metal grinding as PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is thrown! His beloved bike FLIPPING across the desert in wild arcs. He hits the earth with a painful skid, using t momentum to roll back onto his feet. He checks his stomach, the wound's of enina t,}g xnorA, s his shirt bright red. No time for first aid as he turns j in time to see TWO RIDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throwing a STEEL CHAIN to the other, pulling the line tau ready to take him out. Approaching fast. PRIEST

At the last second, DUCKS, grabbing onto. the chain, swin himself around in a graceful arc and KICKING his legs int split. WHAM! his feet SLAM the two cyclists off their bik and into the dirt. He lands back on the ground in a crouch, the steel chain tight in his grip -- Ready for battle. And he gets it.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER FOUR RIDERS
dialogues.text: Circle Priest, surrounding him, the ROAR of their engines like massive power drills. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snaps the chain above his head, bullwhip style, LASHING o The sound of metal shredding as it tangles in Rider #1's handlebars, the bike SWEEPING into the other, CRASHING in tangled mess. With a SNARL the fallen riders LAUNCH at Priest. These vampires are different than the Nightshade tribe. Stronge quicker. Squat bodies of clenched muscles and fangs.

dialogues.speaker: A BRUTAL FIGHT
dialogues.text: Spinning, twisting, kicking, gnashing. Bodies locked in d combat as Priest fends off the ferocious attackers. War cries WHOOPING, the OTHERS TWO RIDERS continue to circle gladiators, dust kicking from their wheels. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rips the BLAST HELMETS off his two attackers. With a SCREECH, their faces burn, bodies instantly SLACKENING in harsh sun. Priest CRUNCHES a vampire in the ribs, knocking the creat off his bike. In a flash, he FLINGS.a helmet into the housing of the last cycle, the bike nosedives, sending th rider across the desert. Eyes brimming with renewed fury, Priest picks up the cycl VROOOOMI! GUNNING the throttle, mod. ROCKETING towards th train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks and the Priestess are riding right beside the colos the sound incredible as the cars rattle across the tracks Carefully, they pull up to the caboose.
PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to be heard) You ready? Hicks nods, maneuvering to the side of his bike and jumpi to the Priestess's, his cycle crashing into the dirt as h LEAPS onto the back of the train. PRIESTESS (CONTIB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going for the engine. Find Lucy. (about to speed off, stops) Before he does. Hicks nods, knowing this'll probably be the last time he her. And with that, she throttles forward, disappearing. Alone, Hicks takes a deep breath, looks at --

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN CAR DOOR
dialogues.text: Who knows what horrors lie behind it? He pops a WAD OF ATOMIC CRAW in his mouth and pulls his six shooters. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My.tuxn now, Priest. BAMI He kicks the door in

dialogues.speaker: INT VAMPIRE TRAIN CAR
dialogues.text: Sunlight bursts into the darkened chamber, but only reach 4 so far, as if the sun itself were scared to enter. Hicks rolls in, guns at the ready. It takes a moment for eyes to adjust but when they do he finds a series of OLD WOODEN COFFINS stacked atop one another like cargo. He quickly moves through the car, careful not to disturb anything. We FOLLOW with him as he exits, entering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Designed so one can move between the cars without exposur the sun, making the train a world of eternal midnight. Carefully, Hicks opens the next compartment's door.,.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pitch black.

The only thing we can make out is a LARGE CAGE, what's in impossible to see in the darkness, just a GIANT HULKING C SHADOW. Its steady, hefty breathing letting us know whate it is, it's asleep. Hicks covers his nose from the bestial smell, the cage ta up so much room he is forced to press himself against the bars, his body just inches from the thing inside.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWITCH OF BLACK LEATHER WINGS
dialogues.text: Makes Hicks stop in his tracks, silently praying to whoev listening. A long moment...and then the steady breathing begins agai Whew. Hicks continues through the cabin, finally making i to the door as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priestess, engine at full boil, makes her way up the train, eyes on the engine up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE BODY OF THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: A long line of tiny SLATS open up, RIFLE BARRELS quickly emerging, snapping into place with a click. BLAM! BLAMI BLAM! The guns FIRE AWAY, bullets blasting all around the Priestess, missing her by millimeters. She flicks down a TOGGLE SWITCH, there's a mighty roar, a massive surge of power and WHOOSH! she ROCKETS forward. T bullets chewing up the dirt behind her! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemingly from out of nowhere, motors up to the train car riding the vampire cycle. He grabs onto a gun barrel and SWINGS into an arc, lifting himself off the bike and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lands on the roof of the train. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cycle quickly ripped apart as it falls under the juggernaut, getting crushed, sparks flying off the rails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest collapses against the metal, the strain beginning wear, he blinks up at the sky, close to passing out. Suddenly a FIGURE steps in front of him, blotting out the sun. Priest squints, unable to trust his eyes, he must be HALLUCINATING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S BLACK HAT. He looks down at Priest, bowing with a slight flourish. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And the third day He shall rise again. Priest can't believe it, seeing his long dead comrade, hi face etched with shock, all he can do is ask -- PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .How? Black Hat smiles, baring hi fangs. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ye of little faith. The understanding hits Priest immediately, crashing over like a wave. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .They turned you. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Priest...I turned them. He smiles wider as we CROSSCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks still hunting for Lucy, making his way to the next He slides open the door, stepping carefully inside, candlelight softly illuminating the space. He's greeted by a sight that makes his blood freeze:

dialogues.speaker: DOZENS OF OPEN COFFINS FILL THE CAR
dialogues.text: Long black boxes lined in orderly rows, flickering light bouncing warmly off their mahogany casings -- The sound o DEEP TORTURED BREATHING lets us know the OCCUPANTS are as
HICKS 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shit. Gritting his teeth, he walks between the rows, quiet as possible. The interiors of the coffins are dark, hard to what's lying inside, just that horrible breathing sound. As Hicks moves past, his body brushes the wood, the space very tight. WHAM! The train CATCHES the rail and the car shakes, KNOCKING HIM INTO A COFFIN! Jarring it. He stops. Holding his breath...but Nothing happens. A quick Hail Mary (the man becoming more of a convert wit every step) and he continues on. He doesn't notice as behind hi a PX rises from one of the, coffins CROSSCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAIN ROOF -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Priest and Black Hat eye each other, landscape whipping p at a furious rate, the train blasting along the tracks. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost souls abandoned by divinity. No belief, no voice to guide them through the wilderness. Sound familiar? Priest doesn't reply, warily eyeing him.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lack of faith. That's what I found in my new brethren And so it was I discovered my true calling -- To teach. To lead. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By murdering innocents? BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By drawing a once great race back to their"nature. By helping them discover' the mastery within themselves. (BEAT) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONTID)
dialogues.text: By putting them in touch with a higher power. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who? BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. Something in the distance catches Priest's eye, a BLACK S on the horizon -- It's The Cities. His jaw tightens, he knows there isn't much time. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is how you go about it? One by one killing every last remaining Priest? BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the only way. The Cities are defenseless now...no one left to stop us from entering our Eden. But I was kind -- I gave every last one the choice I never had. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's your turn. Almost imperceptibly the two make a shift in their postur the tension between the two warming up. Two warriors steeling for a fight.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: it's better to be with your enemies than to be alone, Priest. Humanity had its chance. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to make way for new blood. Priest lowers his head, when he raises it, his reply come easy and without hesitation. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours.

dialogues.speaker: WE HEAR A HUM
dialogues.text: Molecules and electrons bursting from their orbits, the r of the train gently subsiding as if the universe itself w to leave these two room to battle. And before anyone knows it, they're already mid-fight. Th SLAM and COLLISION of bodies giving way to the graceful s and echo of Priest combat.
Then as combustibly fast as it started -- the tableau dro They stand, wind whipping around them in lethal currents, Black Hat having to shout to be heard. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They taught us God created man in His image. . .but they lied. Man created God in a image -- And so, like man, God is weak. Corrupt. Merciless. He wipes away a streak of blood from his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who do you fight for, Priest? The Order's collapsed. The Church nothing but a line of decrepit, ruined old men. Charlatans. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think I'm getting into the cities? Priest's face drops. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your faith has failed you Priest. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join me. Join me and have the best of both worlds --Walk in the sun. Stalk in the night. Why pray to a God when you can BE one? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With ferocious instinct, he launches forward, feet diggin into the metal. The two bodies COLLIDE w th Mic impact. Rolling across th roof, bodies twisting to the edge before FLIPPING onto th next car. The warriors rise, locked in a furious coil.as WHOOSHI tr car after train car passes beneath them. Each leaping at j ust the right moment to land onto the next. But Priest is,outmatched. As they hit the final car, Priest flies across the roof catching the edge with his hand just before he goes over, body dangling over the side. Exhausted and bloodied.
Black Hat calmly approaches, his foot dangerously close t Priest's hand. The landscape below-whipping past at an incredible speed. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your problem is you keep looking to God for-your power -- But I know the real truth. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been praying to an empty sky. And now he SWIPES his foot across the roof, knocking off Priest's hand as one would swat a bug. Priest falls below getting caught under the train and quickly dragged under.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: But you know that now. CROSSCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Priestess, cycle at full throttle, racing beside the TRAIN ENGINE. Up close it's a real mechanical monster, bl metal and heat fused into a superpowered nightmare. The h completely covered. Impervious. MASSIVE PISTONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pump up and down furiously, moving so fast they blur, tur the-giant DRIVE WHEELS that power the locomotive. ANGRY BLASTS OF STEAM vent whi te hot from between the wheels, missing the Priestess. She reaches into her pack and lugs out a CROWBAR, pulling to the beast and managing to stick it between the pistons hoping to jam up the works. The machine chews it up like candy. CROSSCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks is almost at the door, hand reaching for the handle He hears a RUSTLING sound and turns to look behind him... But there's nothing, just the open coffins. Turning back, Hicks catches his breath:

A VAMPIRE hangs upside down from the ceiling, blocking th door. Its red eyes snap in anticipation, a shiny BLACK PROBOSCIS darting from its mouth! Hicks SPITS a wad of ATOMIC CRAW at the creature. It RIEKSI dropping to the floor, writhing. The sick smell of cooked flesh filling the car.

dialogues.speaker: HICKS LOOKS BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: DOZENS OF VAMPIRES ARE NOW AWAKE. Sitting up in their coffins, the foul creatures all blood-eyeing Hicks like t dinner he most surely is. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. With a WAIL, the vampires quickly scramble from their cof sharp talons scratching at the wood, snapping the planks. Desperate, he wrenches open the door, darting into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and manages to SLAM the door behind him just in time as t hungry beings CRASH against itl A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wedges a knife in the door-handle, bashing it with his revolver, jamming the door trapped shut. He turns to head to the next car but there's a THICK CHAI AND PADLOCK wrapped around the door, aWILD-EYED FAMILIAR peering out from inside the door window. Hicks SHOOTS the padlock but no luck, it doesn't break. He's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR BEHIND HICKS BUCKLES ON ITS HINGES
dialogues.text: It'll hold. . .but not for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest is still alive. Barely. He hangs in tatters, desperately clinging to the undercarriage, face and body punched with bruises and blo Jaw set, he begins to move through the undercarriage, han over hand, every movement sheer agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks stares at the door as it starts to BREAK from its hinges. He trains his gun on it, a feeble gesture --- but all he's got left. Then there's a horrible SCREECH. HICKS TURNS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WILD-EYED FAMILIAR charges, attacking from behind, ha unlocked the chain and opened the door. He SCREAMS, sinki a KNIFE in Hicks' side! Hicks spins, slamming his attacker in the nose with a pal heel strike, knocking the Familiar out instantly. Hicks pulls the knife out, blood flowering across his shi as the vampires continue to PUMMEL the door behind, him. He trips over the chain and staggers into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collapsing to the floor, he presses his body against the to close it.

dialogues.speaker: HIS EYES SEARCH THE CAR
dialogues.text: It's bare. Absolutely nothing in here. A single candle burns: ,on the floor, dimly illuminating the room. Weakly, he crosses the space and goes to the next door. T one's got a THICK PADLOCK too,. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Dam. He site on the floor, breathing hard, knowing this is as as he goes. Gradually another sound becomes audible. Hicks listens, nervous. He holds his breath straining to hear. It's someone else's BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORNER
dialogues.text: A HUNCHED FIGURE sits...its back to him. Hidden'in shadow Hicks levels his gun, slowly moving towards the shape, th candlelight giving him a glimpse of its face. He can hardly believe it
HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy? it is. That's when he sees something. Glinting in the darkness, just below her lip. Something sharp. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE STEAM WHISTLE BLASTS
dialogues.text: Howling across the wasteland, the train now racing even faster, furnace cranking out flame like Dante's inferno, Priestess furiously keeping pace with the engine, despera looking for a way in. There is none. She looks up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKYLINE,OF THE CITIES
dialogues.text: Smudged like a greasestain, looms large across the horizo right in the train's path. She squints up to the sky, analyzing the sun, making a qu series of calculationsin her head. Trajectory. Timing. Then she looks at the train. Smiles. She flicks the Nitros Toggle one last time. Her bike ROCK past the train engine, speeding into a curtain of dust. Disappearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks crouches beside Lucy, his gun trained on her. She site listlessly, her skin pale, eyes lost on the wall front of her. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, my name is Sheriff Hicks...I'm here to take you home. No response. She seems almost catatonic. He reaches into his pocket, pulling out her photograph, showing it to her
HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here with your uncle. That gets her attention, she looks at Hicks -- And she lo scared.

dialogues.speaker: WHAP
dialogues.text: The car door outside finally starts to give freely, metal breaking open. The sound of SQUEALING vampires. Hicks runs to.the car door, in one quick motion, SCOOPING the chain and WRAPPING it around the handle, TYING IT TIG just as -- A TALON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches through the opening, long bony fingers swiping at Hicks like switchblades as he falls backwards, pain shoot up his body. ANOTHER ARM breaks through the small window, clawing at t air, the door BANGING REPEATEDLY against the chain. Hicks places himself between Lucy and the door, not notic as she eyes the blood soaking through his shirt. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay behind me. I'll hold `em off as long as I can BLAMI BL.AM! Hicks FIRES, bullets peppering the creatures they HOWL -- but they keep at it, the thick chain stretch tight, ready to snap. ONE VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manages to scramble through, it charges at Hicks, fangs glistening. BAMI With a twitch, it collapses in a heap, a well placed bullet between the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE GATE, not, opened for decades slowly GRINDS ope complex series of CHAINS and WINCHES scraping to life. Th Cities now open to the approaching vampire train.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAIN SAME TIME
dialogues.text: The SCREAM of the whistle like victory as the locomotive approaches the city limits, sending up a giant plume of billowing steam.
The sky above already starting to cloud black as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks continues to FIRE, the vampires seconds from enteri the car. He turns to look back at Lucy. But she's gone. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy? WHAM! A WOODEN. PLANK slams him over the head, knocking t gun from his hand. Woozy, he spins around to find Lucy standing over him, holding the plank above her head. He scoots back just as WHAM! the plank comes back down ag splintering apart across the floor. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, wait She doesn't, jabbing at him with the broken plank, he dod it, barely, but she keeps coming. HICKS (CONT'D) :71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, don't do this! The girl's just too fast. She keeps pushing him backwards until he's dangerously close to the vampire's clawing han Hick's closes his eyes, knowing this is it... A FIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUNCHES through a BOARDED UP HOLE in the floor (the one through which Lucy escaped before), wood splintering into tiny shards. Hicks takes advantage of the distraction and SLUGS Lucy, knocking her unconscious. He dives for his gun, scooping it up and leveling it at t hole, ready to fire at whatever's coming through... IT'S PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks his head through the opening, having been drawn the sound of gunfire. Hicks can't believe it. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for Lucy) Give her to me! Hurry!
Hicks thinks about it, unsure. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They'11.get through the door any second! Give her to mei Screeching, ANOTHER VAMPIRE makes it through the opening, Hicks quickly taking him down in one crack shot. He picks Lucy up, handing her to Priest. Priest disappears with her, Hicks climbing down behind ju as -- the chain finally SNAPS and the door BURSTS open wi screeching vampires! Hicks BLASTS away but there's too many of them, they keep coming. He drops into the hole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing in the undercarriage. Coming face to face with th speeding track, everything shaking like an earthquake. A VAMPIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jabs its head through the hole, teeth chattering-- but th creature can't go any further, the sunlight already makin its skin smoke. On his back, Hicks worms his way down,. following Priest. they climb up a LADDER attached to the side of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work their way up the side, making it to the roof, exhausted. Priest carrying the still unconscious Lucy. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should jump! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until we stop the trains But now Hicks isn't even looking at him, his attention ca up in the horrible sight waiting ahead of them. HICKS (SWALLOWS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. THE CITYSCAPE

t Towers above as the train approaches, so close the smel sulphur and carbon clogs their noses. But that's when something catches Hicks' eye...up ahead o the tracks -- Someone stands. awaiting the train. IT'S THE PRIESTESS -- Standing defiant as the train barre towards her. An ant in front of a battleship. She sees Hicks and Priest-on top of the train, Lucy with Taking one last look at Priest -- she smiles. And spreads her arms open. ON PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified, realizing what she's going to do...and powerle to stop her. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens next happens fast: Priest GRABS Hicks, folding his body around both he and L hands coming together in prayer, feet leaving the train a E ERYTH ggas BLACK The sound of a heartbeat.A threshold. A zone of transitio A BRIGHT FLASH -- we see the TRAIN collide with the. Priestess. The massive grill of the engine CRUMPLING AROU HER as if smashing into a building. She doesn't move. A BRIGHT FLASH -- one by one the train cars SLAM into eac other, the cars JUMPING the rails. MMMM gQES BLACK A BRIGHT FLASH -- and now Priest is falling through the a body shielding Hicks and Lucy, train care skipping across earth, careening through the air.

And WHAM! we FUSE back into real time as train cars CRASH down, sheets of dust clouding the sky in a roiling storm debris and shrapnel, until finally...it all comes to a st It's quiet. We move through the swirling sand until we find -- PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, bruised and bloody, staring at the sky. Watchi A dazed Hicks beside him, Lucy in his arms as she comes t A HORRENDOUS SCREECH fills the air. Led by the Purebloods, HUNDREDS OF VAMPIRES fly out from within the broken cars, taking to the sky in a massive bl swarm, tangling together in flowing shapes. Beautiful. Terrifying. Then in one horrible instant -- They TURN as if guided by an unseen hand, flying towards Cities. Sensing the blood that awaits. HICKS (HORRIFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna make it. The creatures arctowards the metropolis,the city within THEIR REACH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest studies the sky and all at once...he knows. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're not. THE SUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUNCHES through the teeming mass. A few rays at first, but then more and more,-cracking thr the black tide like shattered glass. Hicks' eyes, widen, witnessing an amazing eight as the vampires' bodies collectively BLACKEN and SHRIVEL the swa withering... quickly becoming nothing more than husks. Floating black kites. Hicks and Priest stand, surrounded by the epic destructio fire and smoke casting everything in a surreal haze.
HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew they wouldn't make it. A long time before Priest answers. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew. He turns to THE ENGINE -- its grinning teeth grill CAVED as if smashed by the very hand of God. THE PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies before it. Somehow not a scratch on her...But something's wrong -- something inside her broken, somethi elemental. She doesn't have much time. Priest kneels beside her, taking her hand. Trying to be strong for her. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to? PRIESTESS O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest lowers his head. The following having been spoken him all too often. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You shall wash me and I shall be made whiter than snow. Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Spirit... The words are heavy, each harder than the next. PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- As it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. World without end." (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: A FIGURE escapes through the dust, lurching towards the Cities,-- It's Black Hat. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees him but chooses to stay with the Priestess, brushing hair from her face.
PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish we could've had more time. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Me too. She reaches up, placing her hand on his chest. PRIESTESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever it is we go -- we go together, right? She smiles weakly... but Priest can see she's scared. He gives her one last kiss, cradling her body, sand circl them as she draws her final breath. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun setting on the horizon. A nearby PYRE consumes the last of the Priestess' body as saddles up on a vampire bike, the flames rising behind hi Hicks approaches, Lucy huddled in a blanket, shivering.
