The two men exchange a look, the snap and flash of the fi reflecting in their eyes. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're finished -- You know where to find me. A tense beat then Priest GUNS the engine. Hicks and Lucy watching as he bla towards the Cities, the sky above the color of hellfire. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE CITIES NIGHT
dialogues.text: The sound of a CHOIR. The soaring, ethereal tones carrying us through the fores BRICK SMOKESTACKS-- finally coming to rest on A GIANT CRO atop a mosaic BASILLICA, the colored tiles black with ash We're back in CLERGY CITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening mass. The place is packed, every pew filled with WORSHIPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadows and light. A cabal of MONSIGNORS stand shrouded in white robes, awai to be anointed by ORELAS. A private ceremony. CROSSCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE OF CHILDREN kneel before the altar, the MONSIGNOR raising the Host, offering communion. He suddenly stops, his expression dropping as PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly makes his way down the aisle, bruised and bloodied his very presence a direct affront to this place. A woman GASPS, somebody faints. CROSSCUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orelas dips his hand in water, touching a Monsignor's for ORELAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecces Agnes Dei, ecces qui tollit peccata mundi.

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S A LOUD CRASH
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to see the massive chamber doors BURSTING inwards! THE BODIES OF TWO GUARDS skidding across the mar floor.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST ENTERS THE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: A true force of nature now, coming like the Fourth Horsem Grief and betrayal stoking his anger higher, a blaze igni behind his eyes. BLACK HAT
Steps from the shadows. Deep wounds line his face, the cr tattoo now gouged and distorted with blood -- He smiles. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're too late, Priest. THE MONSIGNORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shed their robes, revealing fresh BITE MARKS on their nec Orelas' new-found fangs glint in the candlelight. ORELAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why shouldn't we live forever? (HISSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're God's very voice. His vessel! PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands shell shocked, the level of betrayal staggering.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT ATTACKS
dialogues.text: SLAMMING.into him, the two warriors going at it in a brut battle, the vampire raking his claws across Priest's face drawing blood. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sends him sailing through the air, Black Hat crashing int collection of CANDLE HOLDERS, an ancient TAPESTRY catchin fire, flames quickly spreading to the other fabrics -- Th chamber erupting in an orange blaze!

dialogues.speaker: THE MONSIGNORS SHRIEK
dialogues.text: Bodies contorting in grotesque shapes as they BECOME. Black Hat stands triumphant, flames rising behind him. BLACK HAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With them I can start anew! You can't stop it -- (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be God's will. He flies across the room, BARRELING into Priest with everything he's got, DIGGING a hand into Priest's wound.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "I looked and beheld a pale horse and His name that sat on him was Death" --
Priest coughs up blood. Black Hat smiles, wrapping a hand around Priest's. throat, LIFTING him off the floor, SQUEE the life from him,

dialogues.speaker: BLACK HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "And all hell followed with him." He raises his head back, ready to sink his teeth. Priest exhausted to fight back. This is it. Prom a b= --

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT GOLD CROSS
dialogues.text: Breaks from the wall with a GROAN, PLUMMETING towards the Black Hat stops, his eyes snapping upward. At the last second -- PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WRENCHES himself from,Black Hat's grip, tumbling. across floor. WHAPI The cross S LM onto Black Hat, pulverizing hi ! Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chunks of glass and stone rain down around Priest, the chamber starting to COLLAPSE. Diving, he barely makes it out, the rotunda .CRASHING down behind him., The Monsignors lunge but Priest manages to jam the doors shut, locking them in. They BASH against the door, SHRIEK horribly, the chamber now an oven. Priest presses against the door, it SPLINTERS all around the terrible sound RISING until finally it stops. PRIEST (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. He collapses, making the sign of the cross. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE stream out of the massive doorway, stampeding down stairs, the giant structure enveloped in smoke and flame. Priest looks up to find FATHER KOEPPEN. The old man stari .at him. A lost soul. KOEPPEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I next? Priest approaches -- Koeppen closing his eyes, ready for blow he knows is to come. But Priest only lifts the man's head, studying his neck. He's clean. And without a single word -- Priest just walks away. When Koeppen opens his eyes, he's a new man -- a man abso With renewed energy, he looks to the crowd around him. An for the first moment in a long time ...He believes. KOEPPEN (CONT'D) (CALLING OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People don't run! God is here for youl He wants you to STOPI Stop and ask yourself a question And the people DO stop, looking to him, the panic leaving their eyes... KOEPPEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask yourselves -- Where am I going? At this, Priest turns, the question catching him as well. And it's only now he realizes -- He has no answer. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windmill. Its rusty blades scrape along, the metal catching the fir rays of the day. AARON PACE is already up, working on rebuilding his house He stops, gazing off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HORIZON
dialogues.text: A cycle. Two black specs riding it. Hicks and Lucy. Dropping his tools, he runs to meet it. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. The moon shines through an open doorway. Lucy lies in bed, Aaron spoon feeding her a warm broth. H smiles, Lucy reluctant to smile back, still uncomfortable with her teeth. But eventually -- for her father...she manages it. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leans against the backwall watching. Lucy glances his way... then shyly looks away. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't thank you enough for what you've done, sheriff. T I HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure she keeps on the tea. It's a special brew -- lessens the bloodthirst...something my granddad taught me. Aaron nods hopefully, squeezing his. daughter's hand. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon. Hicks stands on the porch, enjoying the breeze as he pops wad of chaw in his mouth. A MOVEMENT out in the darkness catches his attention.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: A FIGURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands astride a motorcycle, shadowed in the moonlight. 0
Hicks approaches, the wind kicking up, whistling through emptiness. Even though he can't see him -- Hicks knows wh it is. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be like this. Priest just stands, staring. Hick's hand curls around the revolver. Priest looks to the cabin, the challenge hanging in the a THEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps from the bike, advancing towards Hicks. Hicks pulls his gun, leveling it. Priest keeps coming, the wind blowing harder as he approaches. A feeling of inevitability. Hicks stands his ground, cocking his gun. HICKS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D= I t- -make dQ this. PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares into his eyes and -- Something passes between them something so strong and personal it transcends emotion. Hicks FIRES! But Priest is pone. Hicks looks around -- There's no sign of him, not even the bike. HICKS (CONT'D) (REALIZING) SHIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RACES back to the cabin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hicks BURSTS through the doorway, finding
Sitting peacefully on the bed together, just as he left t Aaron holds up the cup, turning it over. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard you fire your gun. is everything OK? A beat -- then Hicks nods. HICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about, just a coyote. Aaron smiles, happy enough to be with Lucy. AARON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ...we're all God's creatures. Hicks turns, ready to leave, but something on the table catches his eye

dialogues.speaker: THE DESERT RAT' S HOMEMADE CROSS
dialogues.text: He picks it up, turning it in his hand, the colored stone 0 catching the moonlight...How the hell did it get there? AARON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget your cross -- It's beautiful. A flicker of a smile crosses Hick's face, realizing. HICKS ACTUALLY -- (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's for you...and Lucy. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in the darkness, Priest sits on his cycle, his hand clutching the WELL-WORN PHOTO OF THE PACE FAMILY. His eyes shift, gazing into the distance at the outpost, warm glow emanating from within the cabin. He places the photo in his pocket. The wind making a high lonely sound. VRR00000MI
Priest streaks into the night, bathed in moonlight, desolation opening around him. He disappears into the emptiness. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire train. A car lies half-buried in the sand, mangled cage within.

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK CLAW
dialogues.text: Emerges from inside, clamping onto metal, something dragg itself out into the moonlight. It's a PUREBLOOD. With a SCREECH it takes to the night sky, massive black w fluttering, arcing towards the twinkling metropolis. FADE OUT
